GeneralBoatDescription: The bowsprit, mounted on the starboard side of the bow, which makes the 10R the first sprit boat Beneteau has offered to its North American market. The 10R is also the first model built using the company's proprietary "One Shot" infusion process, in which the hull and structure are molded at the same time, achieving an even distribution of the resin throughout the entire boat. The hull and deck are balsa cored, except below the waterline, and under deck fittings, where solid glass is used, which makes for a light hull for a boat the 10R's size, around 9,800 pounds.Farr Yacht Design, a partner with Beneteau for many years, designed a smart interior for the 10R. By placing the head on centerline in the forepeak, they've created one of the best spinnaker-retrieval and launching spaces found on any production boat today. The large, half-moon hatch provides good ventilation dockside, and a more than adequate opening for spinnaker work. The head's sole is covered with molded nonskid and has a drain in the center to drain away water from wet spinnakers. The carbon spinnaker pole retracts into a fiberglass sheath in the head two rubber gaskets prevent water intrusion. Any water that does manage to sneak in drains via a weep hole and clear rubber tube led to the bilge. Aft of the head/spinnaker operations center is a bulkhead that's tabbed into the hull, as is the bulkhead aft of both settees, which supports the load from the shrouds and keel. Aft of the bulkhead on port and starboard are two straight settees (curved settees are great for dinner parties, but make lousy offshore berths), which flank a drop-leaf table. The portside, L-shaped galley is across from the nav station, and since both are at max beam, they're both roomy. In fact, the nav station, which faces forward, is roomier than some larger boats we've sailed. Aft to starboard is the owner's stateroom with a double bunk, to port a single. Thanks to the head-forward layout, both aft berths are further forward than they might otherwise be, which keeps weight out of the stern.Racers who've spend time racing aboard the 10R First love the cockpit, which has plenty of room for helmsman, main trimmer, two headsail trimmers, and a pitman. Immediately forward of the open transom is a large hatch, which accesses a storage area that accepts an optional liner designed to hold a small liferaft. The large, 63-inch aluminum wheel is covered with leather, and with only three-quarters of a turn lock-to-lock, is designed to provide the same precise, fingertip control as a tiller. The Harken mainsheet traveler is immediately forward of the wheel, and thanks to the low cockpit coamings, is an extremely comfortable area for the mainsheet trimmer, especially when the boat is heeled. Fine and gross-trim backstay controls are well within the trimmer's reach on either tack. Two Lewmar 46 AST winches are mounted on the cockpit coaming for headsail trim, and two Lewmar 40s sit on either side of the companionway to handle the halyards and control lines leading aft from the Hall carbon-fiber mast. Twin banks of Spinlock jammers sit forward of the two Lewmar 40s. Because the cabin trunk extends very far the genoa and jib tracks are pushed outboard of where they really should be, the 10R requires jib inhaulers for the 150-percent genoa, and the jib, allowing the clew to be sheeted inboard around the shrouds. Thanks to the fact that the headsail's Harken furler sits belowdecks, 10R owners get the best of both worlds, a proper deck-sweeping headsail, and the ease of a furler, which makes mark roundings a lot less complicated.The 10R's deck has molded non-skid, which provides good traction. The high aspect, T-shaped bulb keel is the latest in keel bulb shapes. Sailing the First 10R in a medium breeze with the 150-percent overlapping genoa, the 10R powered up quickly as the wind hit its top end for the day. Upwind, sails between 5.8 to 6.5 knots. Sailing downwind with the asymmetric the boat is a blast. Crewing on the 10R is a delight. From the footrests for the helmsman, to the eminently workable cockpit, and ergonomic deck layout, Farr and Beneteau's vast experience designing and building racer/cruisers is evident in every aspect of the 10R's performance.

GeneralBoatDescription:
Custom Irwin 68' staysail ketch powered by Perkins 200hp turbo diesel.

Northern Lights 20KW generator with reverse cycle air conditioning & heat in five private staterooms.

Spacious gourmet galley with built-in refrigerator/freezer, dish washer, trash compactor, Force 10 LPG stove & oven, Nutone food processor, double stainless sinks, and custom wine rack.

Topsides features a huge cockpit with bimini and full enclosure, followed by an on deck jacuzzi.

There is an extended transom with electrically operated swim platform and custom lazarrette bulkhead which will accommodate a jet ski.

Complete marine electronics include Vigil 24 mile radar, Magellan GPS nav plotter, Autohelm pilot, Icom SSB, Standard Horizon knot, log, depth, VHF and more. 

Vessel is wired for computer & printer, phone and there is TV, VCR, CD player, and AM/FM stereo with speakers inside and out.

Additional items include heavy duty electric windlass with up & down deck switch with remote, stern davit with Avon 14' RIB w/70hp Yamaha, Sea Recovery 600 GPD watermaker, Kenmore washer & dryer and more.

All furling sails, with mast pulpits, rod rigging, and custom aft deck seating.

Motivated seller looking for offers, so call now!

Accommodations

Aft of the chain locker in the forepeak is a V berth with hanging locker. Forward guest cabin to port has over under berths. Both cabins share the forward head, with access from V berth cabin and from center line. Continuing aft to starboard is spacious galley with laundry room opposite. Up a few steps to the salon which features large U shape settee to starboard with two teak hinged tables. Opposite to port is settee and liquor locker. Navigation area faces aft on the port side. Down a few steps on center one finds double staterooms both port & starboard, each with adjoining heads. GeneralBoatDescription: This is an excellent example of a beautifully maintained Jeanneau 49 Deck Salon.  Her flag blue LP hull and white deck have been buffed and waxed 3x's per year since new.  Her wood work has been maintained to the same standard and looks brand new with a professional maintenance staff attending to her every detail.  She has had many custom upgrades which add to her sailing enjoyment and comfort when aboard.  Her owners have spared no expense in making her the perfect yacht for the discerning sailor.
AdditionalDetailDescription:
Interior Description

This boat is configured in the popular 3 cabin layout with master forward and twin cabins aft to maximize use.  There is rich teak woodwork throughout with Ultra-leather fabric on the seat cushions.  Her main salon is open with a great amount of natural light due to the large cat-eye windows and many large opening ports.
The U-shaped dinette to starboard features seating for 6 with the use of the additional cabin chairs.  There is plenty of storage under the seating and extra storage cabinets outboard. 

The deluxe dinette table features additional drawer storage underneath.  Across you will find a large settee with storage underneath.  There are storage cabinets both outboard and forward as well as a large flat screen TV mounted in the corner of the salon for easy viewing from any direction.  The navigation station is forward facing with Chartplotter, VHF, and all controls to monitor the electrical system within easy reach.

The L-shaped galley is nicely laid out with plenty if counter space for preparing meals, good access to refrigeration and cooking surfaces, as well as plenty of storage above and below the Corian counters with additional pantry storage below the flooring.  Under the center salon floor is a large locker perfect for the storage of bulk items.

The master cabin forward features a center-line queen berth for the comfort of her owners.  There is a nice vanity with seat and plenty of storage throughout.  The en-suite head has a Jabsco Quiet flush electric head, vanity with stainless steel basin, and separate shower stall.  Each of the aft cabins feature double berths, hanging lockers, and plenty of storage.  The twin aft cabins feature double berths and hanging locker space.  The center-line dividing wall is removable to convert the area into one large cabin for additional comfort.  The aft head features a Jabsco Quiet flush electric head and vanity with basin sink and handheld faucet shower combination.

Hull and Deck

The Jeanneau 49DS is a modern hull shape created by Phillipe Briand.  It features a plumb bow with a long waterline and beam carried well aft.  Her under-body is sleek with a fine entry, deep draft fin keel, and large spade rudder.

The Hull of the Jeanneau 49 is built utilizing traditional construction methods with horizontal and longitudinal stringers glassed directly to the hull.  The hull is constructed of GRP with Kevlar reinforcement.  Additional strength is garnered through the distribution of load across the hull surface with floors laminated integrally to the hull.  The deck is a sandwich construction over a balsa core with hardwood insert backing for all deck hardware.  Both hull and deck are secured together utilizing a polyurethane filler and reinforced with aluminum foot strapping.

Her hull is finished in a beautiful flag blue LP.  The deck and nonskid are white.  The toe rail is made of varnished teak with additional varnished teak accents on the coach roof.  The cockpit floor and transom steps are oiled teak with a varnished teak cockpit table.

GeneralBoatDescription:
33' Greenline Hybrid 2014

Dealer stock, never title

CALL FOR DETAILS!

The world’s first serialized production hybrid yacht, the Greenline 33 has truly changed the face of yachting and is a classic in the making. Since the launch of their first boat less than 3 years ago, Greenline has earned a reputation for an ever-evolving pedigree. Now the largest hybrid fleet in the world (over 300 boats launched), Greenline has been honored with 19 international awards.

The secret behind the Greenline's success lies in the combination of three key innovations: its patented “Superdisplacement” hull, Hybrid propulsion systems and new manufacturing technologies. This environmentally friendly combination is the foundation that has led to Greenline's expansion into 30 countries worldwide. 

The Greenline 33 is available with a variety of hybrid and “hybrid ready” power configurations to best suit your boating needs. There are a myriad of options available that will ensure your boat meets your demands and the demands of your cruising environment.  Please call to customize a boat that you can not only feel good on but also feel good about.
AdditionalDetailDescription:

Superdisplacement Hull

Greenline’s protected Superdisplacement® hull shape generates less drag, less wake, creates the ability to use less fuel, generates lower CO2 emissions, and enables the use of (limited) electric power. This hull geometry produces less wake, offers better seaworthiness and easier handling than any comparable hull.

The reduced energy requirement means less running cost, less refueling stops and more time in your favorite anchorage or cruising archipelago.

The hulls are outstandingly efficient throughout their speed range, bringing unbeatable mileage and range of over 700 nautical miles at a speed of 7 knots. This, combined with a top speed up to 15 knots, makes long day trips a breeze. The electric drive mode will not only allow for cruising in complete silence at speeds of up to 6 knots, but also offer a range of up to 20 nautical miles, before the diesel motor is required.

Besides being efficient, the Superdisplacement hull shows optimum performance in all sea conditions - an important factor in comfort and safety when underway. The Greenline manages any kind of sea situation with ease, needing only minute corrections at the wheel.

The twin sacrificial stabilisers are a further advantage of this hull, and have three functions: they deliver roll stability, tracking stability, and protect the drive and rudder. If the stabilisers get damaged, the structure of the boat will not be affected. The fins can be quickly and inexpensively replaced.

Benefits

  • comfortable, safe ride
  • easy manoeuvring
  • low running costs

Hybrid Drive System


A fully electronically managed and maintenance-free system.

Greenline Hybrid can collect, store and use electrical energy from the sun, from the shore pick-up or from the main engine driven generator. With a solar array and a Hybrid drive electric unit the yacht is a mobile power station providing a constant supply of AC power (230 or 120 VAC) on board.

The user-friendly and reliable hybrid drive system (protected) consists of the following elements:

  • A single switch that lets you choose between two drive modes: diesel or electric.
  • A modern diesel engine mutually developed with our partners.
  • A fully electronically managed and maintenance-free electric motor/generator (eM/G), which consumes 7 kW in the electric drive mode and provides 5 kW of electrical power when driven by the diesel engine (charging the batteries and supplying power to on-board consumers). The two components are integrated into one unit, thereby saving space and weight. The eM/G is coupled to a specifically developed gearbox with our well chosen partners.
  • A hydraulic clutch between the diesel engine and the electric motor/generator
  • A 3 kW inverter/charger that charges the battery in the shore power mode and delivers a 230 V AC power supply throughout the boat at all times.
  • A 1.4 kW solar array delivering green electric power to the batteries during daytime. No cost and emission-free sailing is possible at low speed
  • A Lithium battery pack (same as the one driving your mobile phone or laptop computer) with a capacity of 12 kWh. Lightweight and compact (seven times lighter and one third of lead battery size) these batteries are rated at thousands of cycles. With a life expectancy of 10 years they represent the best choice for a hybrid boat.

  • Benefits

    • simple maintenance
    • ease of use
    • use of electric energy for propulsion: the running cost of electric boating is 10 times less than burning diesel fuel, even disregarding solar energy
    • eliminating smoke and noise
    • 230 (120) VAC power system

Solar Roof

The solar roof array keeps the batteries fully charged and provides additional energy for the boat’s electric drive system. No-cost and emission-free sailing is possible at low speed where the amount of energy harvested from the sun and the system’s energy consumption are equal, making the Greenline Hybrid a solar sailboat.

6 standard photovoltaic solar panels with forced air cooling deliver up to 1.4 kW of electric power in daylight conditions.

As the solar cells are protected against hail by a 3.2 mm glass shield and are easy to access for cleaning, your solar power station requires only a minimum of maintenance. It is capable of supplying constant power to on-board consumers like the refrigerator and TVs and can recharge the batteries to 100% when exposed to a full
day of sunlight.

Benefits

  • green energy production
  • cost and emission-free sailing
  • no maintenance

Lithium Battery

Just like your mobile phone or laptop computer, the Greenline Hybrid uses the best lithium battery technology available: a 11,5 kWh on Greenline 33, 23 kWh on Greenline 40 and 46 kWh on Greenline 46 (battery pack with a permissible discharge of 100%).

Rated at thousands of charge cycles, these batteries outperform lead battery types by a factor of five to six. Very powerful, light-weight (7 times lighter, 1/3 of normal battery size) and maintenance-free, these batteries are the best choice for your hybrid boat.

Benefits

  • low maintenance
  • ease of use
  • more time spent out on the water, whether cruising or at anchor
  • estimated 10 years life expectancy
  • lightweight and compact

GeneralBoatDescription:
2016 pricing still available.... 

NEW 2017 Privilege Serie 5 for charter in "Virgin Islands"-call for details

                    See why this is the most popular Privilege!

2017 Series 5...a concentration of elegance, refinement and sailing power on the water. Privilege is well know as the crème de la crème of luxury catamarans!

Always in partnership with the technical expertise of the naval architect Marc Lombard and the famous yachts designer Franck Darnet with the renowned Bureau Veritas signature approval. Privilege Marine is the only shipyard to have signed an agreement with Bureau Veritas for regular inspections and visits to oversee every yacht produced for its specific quality.

Privilège Series 5 offers: wonderful sailing ability, one level salon and cockpit, spaciousness in living areas, amazing 20’ bedroom, larger openings, evolution of rig, and new style to the layout of the cockpit and interiors allowing for choices…customization!

All Privilege models employ real wood interiors attesting to their well known reputation for everlasting luxury and prestige.

Over 600 Privilege catamarans are sailing worldwide!

Call for chartering XENIA 50 the 2015 Privilege Series 5 in the Virgin Islands!

Denison Yacht Sales is the exclusive North American Privilege Dealer.

The helm station gives an elevated view of all the deck and cockpit areas for ease of sailing and socializing.

With one level living, the saloon is an extension to the cockpit offering a large living area. The galley up opens to the saloon, which gives a friendly atmosphere: large seating spaces, excellent storage areas, double sink, bar style bench, chart table within easy access to the helm station and the dining area is generous and very comfortable with large square seating, convertible table and always a view to the sea.

Ventilation is optimized with the portholes on the side and deck hatches. Light and airy, the view from the cabin during your cruise is open and vast.

GeneralBoatDescription:
2015 pricing still available.......

Introducing the new custom model... 2016 Privilege SERIE 7…already on Hull Number 3!

-Only a limited number of Series 7 available....take advantage of the strong dollar and reserve pricing.

This is the new flagship of the Privilege range. At 76' the Series 7 is the optimal evolution of the Privilege 745 with six catamarans sailing the world. Today, this Series 7 model inherits improvements in the interior as well as the hull for renowned luxury and performance! The hull is lengthened, the transoms longer…for smooth comfortable sailing!

Always in partnership with the naval architect Marc Lombard; with Franck Darnet Design team offering a modern style interior with furniture, fabrics and colors customized per your wishes. The standard salon in maple wood remains a refined area, light, quiet, and very comfortable…and always a choice in various real wood interiors.

More light and visibility with the 26’ wide owner’s cabin, comfort, silence and refinement guaranteed. Each companionway offers a set of choices: wine cellar, fruit-and-vegetable store, laundry, restroom, video office, cinema, etc…and the salon is truly open, bright and decadent beyond belief!

PRIVILEGE MARINE pays particular attention to interior design so that your yacht is the reflection of your desires…customize!

A spacious fly bridge for guest enjoyment and entertainment during the day to soak up beautiful views with a breeze!…and at night a wonderful dining experience under the stars!… all sail handling systems and controls are forward within arm’s reach leaving the large aft fly deck uncluttered and free.

More opulence!…salon lounge and bar/kitchenette area on port side with coffee table and a deep L-shaped seating for relaxing with a friendly atmosphere, dining area on starboard with L-shaped, rectangular table removable to a large day-bed, furniture for video system with storage for swiveling TV screen. An envied navigation station, galley fully fitted and crew quarters on starboard passageway similar to larger yachts.

Privilege signature hull, nacelle, and the deck are fully vacuum infused with glass/vinylester sandwich. The internal structure is technologically advanced transversal and longitudinal vacuum sandwich bulkheads directly stratified to the hull and deck. A vinylester anti-osmosis barrier is applied to the whole structure.

In addition to EC certification, the famous survey/inspection control company BUREAU VERITAS certifies each Privilege hull is built with strict non-negotiable requirements ensuring long term success.

Contact the exclusive North American Dealer for details.
AdditionalDetailDescription:
NEW PRIVILEGE Series 7

2015 PRIVILEGE  Above all relax….decadent benches, sofas and tables, the fly bridge is a spacious and elegant haven for relaxation inspired by the world’s most luxurious resorts. The magnificent fly bridge can be easily accessed from the cockpit via the teak spiral stairway. Marc Lombard’s design excellence is proven once again with the volume created by the bridge deck helm station. All sail handling systems and controls can be operated from here leaving the aft fly deck uncluttered and completely available for guest enjoyment, entertainment and alfresco dining.

The flagship Privilege 76' is a stunning masterpiece of advanced technology and quality craftsmanship. The bridge deck is used to full advantage with the added benefits of a seating area, table and a sunbathing platform allowing guests to view dazzling surroundings while sailing crystal blue waters.

The hull, the nacelle (main pod), and the deck are fully vacuum infused on a strong base of glass / vinylester sandwich.

The internal structure is made up entirely of transversal and longitudinal vacuum sandwich bulkheads, directly stratified to the hull and the deck.

Strength and lightness are ensured, whilst allowing some flexibility (needed by the forces applied during offshore navigation).

The necessary monolithic areas and the various reinforcements are also built by vacuum infusion. A vinylester anti-osmosis barrier is applied to the whole structure.

In complement to the usual EC certification, the famous survey office BUREAU VERITAS has been hired by the shipyard, on a yearly basis, in order to control and certify each unit built; the requirements are strict.

GeneralBoatDescription:
Cruising Boat of the Year!!!

PURE ELEGANCE

The Dufour 560 Grand Large flagship sets the highest standards when it comes to aesthetic appeal. The yacht exudes modern elegance, luxury and dynamism with its sweeping lines and uniquely DUFOUR top fixed hatch, with angled corners and horizontal sleek side windows, the GL 560 delivers a striking visual statement. 

Very balanced hull shape, with powerful aft sections, low wetted surface area and a very effective set of appendages (keel & rudder). The high ballast ratio and increased form stability of the hull enables the boat to support a powerful sailplan without sacrificing cruising comfort and safety. The sail plan has been designed to guarantee maximum performance with minimum effort. The fixed bowsprit, the self tacking jib and the boom inclined forward are all examples of a sail plan that makes handling easy.

title: Dufour 560 Grand Large
Exterior Walkthrough w/ John Zagorski
desc: Dufour has tapped into that formula and introduced a flagship, the Grand Large 560, that picks up where its groundbreaking 50-foot sibling left off. The GL 560’s profile is low, with a plumb bow and a hard chine, and it looks serious and fast. The beam is 16 feet, 6 inches, and it flows well aft to create a very spacious boat at the transom. The cockpit is divided into “maneuvering” and “comfort” zones, to segregate the business of running the boat from the enjoyment of entertaining.

results.ListingTitle: Cruising World Boat of the Yr
GeneralBoatDescription:
Cruising World Magazine's Best Full-Size Production Cruiser

SAIL Magazine's pick for Best Flagship Cruiser 

The Dufour 512 perfectly combines the philosophy of a yacht with elegant and luxurious style as well as outstanding performance. 

After the success of the Dufour 500 GL, selling over 140 units in 2 years, Dufour proposes a revisited version of this exceptional yacht which benefits from all the innovations and features integrated in the latest Grand Large models. 

While sailing, the new fixed bowsprit, helmsman console, and inclined boom are advantages for easy maneuvering.  At anchor, you will enjoy the fully equipped exterior galley with barbecue, sink and fridge as well as the wide sunbaths and lighted handrails for an unreached lifestyle approach on any yacht of the same category. 

Incredible performance, easy to sail and dreamily elegant, the Dufour 512 promises intense emotions in all conditions and embodies a new dimension to sailing adventures.

title: SAIL's Best Boats 2014: Dufour 500 Grand Large

ExternalLink.Text: SAIL Magazine's Best Boats 2014: Dufour 500 Grand Large
Crusing World Winner - Best Full Size Production Cruiser!

Office.Name: Denison Yacht Sales - Marina Del Rey

GeneralBoatDescription:
Evolution of the famous Dufour 410, the Dufour 412 Grand Large places herself among the flagships of the Grand Large range. For 2016, Dufour Yachts engineers and Felci Yachts Design have integrated all functionalities thus far reserved to bigger sized yachts.

Ambitious challenge skillfully executed, this starts with the optimization of the exterior spaces. The new closed cockpit by its aft seats conceals a fully equipped exterior galley with barbecue, sink and refrigerator. This new layout, at once functional and securing, allows to take advantage of the entire cockpit, and makes the boat more spacious.

The Dufour 412 also benefits from new equipments for always more pleasant navigation, in particular the fixed bowsprit to simplify the mounting of downwind sails. 

With her new look and her new equipment, the Dufour 412 is an exceptional yacht and naturally places herself among the upscale level in her category.

AdditionalDetailDescription:
2014 Privilege Marine Series 6

Series 6...a modern design-higher bridge deck clearance.. for more safety at sea, silence underway, and comfort in weather. Performance enhanced hull design.

As always Privilege allows for CHOICES..real wood interior, layout changes, equipment enhancements and most important..listening to your desires in creating a special catamaran interior. 

The illuminated cockpit offers many choices: a flexible and friendly outside living area: comfortable dining area for 10 persons with a table and squared seating, additional lounge area with convertible coffee table or outside kitchenette. The helm station gives an elevated view of all the deck and cockpit areas for ease of sailing and socializing with a full flybridge and twin helms for ease of sailing.

With one level living, the salon is an extension to the cockpit offering a large living area. The cockpit opens to the salon, which gives a friendly atmosphere: large seating spaces, excellent storage areas, double sink, bar style bench, chart table within easy access to the helm station and the dining area is generous and very comfortable with large square seating, convertible table and always a view to the sea.

Layouts: Owners, 5 Cabin or Family versions, Customized

Owners Version: The owner’s cabin is a real bedroom over 20 feet wide which is unique on a catamaran. A king bed, with private access, one to the head with separate shower and the other to the dressing table, dressing room and storage. Ventilation is optimized with the portholes on the side and deck hatches. Light and airy, the view from the cabin during your cruise is open and vast.

GeneralBoatDescription:
44' | Tiara 4400 Sovran | 2003

Exceptionally Well Maintained Express Cruiser

Caterpillar Engines, Kohler Generator, Water Maker, Heat & A/C,

Low Hours, 10' Dinghy w/ 15 HP Outboard, Radar, GPS 

Slip Available with Marina Management Approval !

This is one of the nicest 40+ express cruisers listed on the market today. This particular Tiara 4400 is the definition of a well maintained and well equipped vessel. This yacht is truly turn-key ready to cruise the west coast and beyond. The elegant dark blue hull color contrasts the pure white cockpit cushions and non skid decks, while the hard top provides stylish security from the elements. The entire layout is designed and equipped for entertaining guests with speakers, folding tables, and plenty of comfortable seating through out. The interior decor and wood finish looks as though it just came from the factory yesterday. The owner has had his fun and is ready to pass this gem onto the next lucky yachtsman ready for new adventures. Don't wait any longer, start living your dream today.

Call for more information or to schedule a showing !
AdditionalDetailDescription:
Detailed Equipment Lists & Descriptions:

Manufacturer Provided Description/Accommodations:

Tiara Yachts is proud to offer another beautifully designed and constructed yacht - the 4400. A gel coat outer layer, high-performance tie-coat quadaxial fiberglass, balsa core, epoxy resin, and vacuum bag technology lay the groundwork for a yacht that's unsurpassed in quality and simple quiet elegance. The long, sweeping deck of the 4400 is constructed with a gel coat outer layer, hand-laid fiberglass and balsa core with vinyl ester resin. The beautifully crafted, custom-curved composite windshield is seamlessly integrated with the hardtop of the 4400. Behind the composite windshield, the 4400 incorporates a hinged helm console, with full engine instrumentation and an admiral full double-wide helm seat which is adjustable forward to aft, up and down. Intuitive design plus time-tested placement of gauges, throttles, and controls, ensure that being behind the helm is akin to a ride on cloud nine. The aft of the 4400 offers a standard swim platform, extending the 4400 by an extra 52 inches. This extra space provides room for a personal watercraft, an inflatable dinghy, and / or plenty of room for family and friends to enter and exit the water on a diamond patterned non-skid surface. Rear storage space is built-in and accessed through a hydraulically actuated fiberglass hatch. Below decks, the 4400 features plush leather seating, Corian countertops, stainless steel sink, abundant storage, and a built-in 22-inch flat screen TV with DVD technology. The lounge features a folding birds eye maple / teak table which converts to berth, increasing sleeping accommodations to six. The master stateroom boasts a queen-size pedestal bed, with spring mattress, and storage below. The second stateroom not only comes with two overlapping, bunk style beds but also a combination washer / dryer. The second stateroom also has it's own access to the head.

GeneralBoatDescription: Built on the Sparkman-Stevens tradition at Queen Long, this wonderful solid, sea-kindly cruiser is Baja proven with full set of extras.  There have been precious few on the market in the past couple of years, making this an exceptional value.  The standard 2007 Hylas equipment and a full selection of options give a cruiser just about everything: gen set, water-maker, air conditioning, Schaefer Gamma furling main, carbon whisker pole, custom Well's arch with solar. She is tasteful appointed and super clean below with bright bamboo and teak sole.  This semi-custom model has dual Frigoboat stainless steel refer/freezer in the galley and a custom port cabin layout with laundry/additional storage areas/sea berth.

Swivel reading lights and fans over port and starboard side of owners berth, 110AC outlets, 12VDC outlets and stereo volume control.  Aft facing opening ports. Mirror on inside of owner head door on head side.  Custom teak trim Ocean Air Hatch

AdditionalDetailDescription:
Manufacturer Provided Description

At 37 feet 8 inches, the Carver Trojan 360 Express is a midsize express yacht. Yet within her sleek profile exists a surprisingly spacious cabin offering the luxury and comfort of designer hardware and fixtures, and cherry wood cabinets and trim. Below deck, the 360 can accommodate five overnight. The master stateroom forward features a queen-sized berth, his and her cedar-lined hanging lockers, and plenty of drawer storage. Amidships, the dinette converts to a single berth. Sun worshipers will enjoy the recessed foredeck sunpad and the spaciousness of the cockpit. The U-shaped cockpit seating with its optional table, sunlounge and icemaker create the perfect package for an easy afternoon of entertaining. Add an available generator and air conditioning to a galley that's complete with a two-burner range, microwave and refrigerator, and the Trojan 360 Express becomes a great overnight package.

GeneralBoatDescription:
37' | Sea Ray 370 Sundancer | 1996

Very Clean, Well Maintained Vessel

Seller is Very Motivated
AdditionalDetailDescription:
Manufacturer Provided Description
Unmistakably one of the Sea Ray mid-cabin cruisers, the Sea Ray 370 Sundancer brings new definition to performance and styling in a sport yacht. With the power of twin 7.4L MerCruiser V-drives and the seaworthiness of a wide beam and deep-V hull, the 370 Sundancer cuts through heavy seas with certainty and comfort. The burl instrument panel features custom Sea Ray backlit instrumentation with low-glare blue night lighting and plenty of room for charts and documents. An emergency start system backs up the primary system for additional peace of mind. Standard Raytheon electronics package includes VHF, GPS, and Raydata multifunction depth finder, speed - sumlog, and water temperature instrument. The portside refreshment center has a wet bar, sink, cooler, and icemaker. The portside bench seat has a fiberglass step for easy boarding. Integrated fender storage in the transom has a gas-assisted door for easy access. A freshwater washdown with cockpit shower and dockside water inlet provides convenient access to fresh water while on board. A Lofrans Progress I rope - chain windlass makes anchoring easy. Aluminum fuel tanks with fuel filters, anti-siphon valves and electric senders prevent corrosion and improve fuel quality, safety, and convenience. Below, the main salon features a curved banquette with cocktail - dining table, full galley, sunken conversation area, spacious forward stateroom, and fully enclosed head. Faux granite countertops and tables, tasteful upholstery, handcrafted wood trim, and deep-pile marine carpet are just some of the features in the salon. The TV-VCR combination is one of two in the cabin. There's also a Clarion AM-FM digital cassette stereo with six-disc CD changer, amplifier, subwoofer, eight speakers, and cockpit remote. The sofa converts to a double bed for extra guests. The conversation pit converts to a double stateroom with a privacy curtain and mirrored divider. A vanity with drawers provides guests a place to stow belongings. A sliding screened window admits natural light and fresh air. The forward stateroom has a full-size pedestal bed, port and starboard vanities, and hanging lockers with mirrored doors, side shelf storage and a TV-VCR - radio combination. The full galley includes a three-burner electric stove with stainless steel stove rail, refrigerator, microwave, and coffeemaker. The head compartment has a VacuFlush toilet, sink with vanity, and a separate shower with bifold door. A large deck hatch, port light, and air conditioning provide light and air circulation.

Ready to Cruise, Will Consider All Offers

This one owner yacht has been very well maintained since day one. The vessel comes equipped with lots of additional features not found on most cruising yachts. The preferred three cabin layout and spacious cockpit seating provides lots of room for entertaining family or friends. This yacht is perfect for anyone looking for a reliable coastal cruiser. Manufacturer Provided Description

Bringing the cockpit full beam allows the use of a custom console complete with mechanical steering, electronics space, twin fold down tables, and even a storage bin with drink holders. The standard recessed windlass allows the capability of handling two anchors simultaneously on the dual offset anchor roller. Self-draining propane lockers on both port and starboard are convenient, safe, and practical. The Hunter trademark cockpit arch keeps the adjustable traveler up and out of the way and makes a great attachment point for the Bimini. Hand-rubbed teak and exquisite fabrics are in evidence throughout the grand interior, where storage is plentiful as is natural light and ventilation. The dinette area is large enough to handle the crew, but intimate enough for two. An enormous dual-opening refrigerator and freezer are central to the U-shaped galley. Force 10 stove and oven, plus a microwave, will make dinners a joy to prepare while the island sink will have cleanup covered. Storage for everything is at hand including the recessed trash receptacle. Entertaining is gracious with the open salon which incorporates a TV and CD stereo. Twin comfortable seats and a convertible cocktail table are located just forward of the extensive nav station with plenty of space for electronics and gear. The forward master stateroom rivals most yachts twice her size. Twin hanging lockers and lots of drawers make staying aboard easy, and a great night's sleep is guaranteed by the inner-spring mattresses. The forward master head is spacious and provides plenty of storage. The master shower is separate from the head, allowing private use at all times; a drop down seat is even included for comfort. Aft, there is a choice of two layouts: dual staterooms or a single stateroom and an office - work area. Both are large, airy, and comfortable. In addition, an aft head with integral shower is positioned for convenient access from the aft stateroom or from the salon.

GeneralBoatDescription:
The Ferretti 50 Motor Yacht is a stylish boat with a beautiful interior and a good turn of speed.  It provides three staterooms, an inside helm, and a salon that opens directly onto the cockpit to create a spacious entertaining area.

This boat is powered by twin Caterpillar diesel engines, and is equipped with a full suite of electronics, a generator, air conditioning and a bow-thruster.  It is in good condition and ready to go.  

UPDATE MARCH 2015:  Now with a $50,000 price reduction!  Call to arrange a viewing!
AdditionalDetailDescription:
Accommodations

From the cockpit, you can enter straight into the salon, where you will find a leather sofa to port, and an entertainment center to starboard.  The salon features beautiful cherry woodwork and granite countertops, and is air conditioned throughout.

The galley is down to starboard, and is equipped with everything you need to feed a hungry crew.

Moving forwards there is a raised dinette to starboard where you can eat diner while looking out over the harbor.  

Opposite to port is an inside helm with all the equipment required to operate the vessel including a bow thruster, electronic engine controls, and a Raymarine display.  Beside the helm there are stairs leading up to a hatch to the flybridge.

Down a few steps forward takes you to the sleeping accomodations where you have a master stateroom forward with a private head, and two twin berth staterooms to port and starboard that share another head.

AdditionalDetailDescription:
Walk Through

The racing cockpit is large and comfortable with the wheel on a pedestal and in a steering well. Access to the interior of the boat is down a centerline companionway. Underneath the companionway is the engine box, which has easy access. The interior of the yacht is very well appointed for an ultralight racing boat. The boat has an open and well lit feel although is closed and private enough for crew members while cruising. Landing below, to starboard, is the galley which has three burner gimbaled stainless steel stove and oven. There are duel quarter berths in the back of the galley on starboard as well. There are two more quarter berths to around the back to port as well. Opposite the galley to port is the navigation station with chart salad is amidships wth a "U" settee and table to starboard and settee to port. The mast steps at the forward at the forward end of the compartment Forward to starboard is the enclosed head with vacuum toilet and sink. Opposite to port is a separate shower stall. Forward still is a double guest cabin with a transom berth to starboard and a short settee to port. An en-suite to starboard head had a vacuum toilet and vanity sink. All the way forward is open sail stowage with escape hatch overhead. Beautiful brand new wood flooring throughout entire boat.

GeneralBoatDescription: This Jeanneau 42 Deck Salon is in stellar condition; kept by one owner and maintained to professional standards. It has a spacious interior with two large cabins both equipped with stall showers and heads. The teak flooring is also well kept and aesthetically pleasing. Great for cruising and convenient for racing, the boat comes with electric winches and twin steering wheels. Ideal for any sailor.
AdditionalDetailDescription:
Walk Through

Aboard this Jeanneau 42 Deck Salon you will find a spacious and comfortable feel to the entire boat. Starting from the steering wheels working forward you will see custom leather covers for each wheel as well as an all teak cockpit floor, seats, and cockpit table. There is a Raymarine chart-plotter at the helm and it is uniquely installed to allow for 270 degree use. On deck, moving forward form the steering section you will find two Harken electric two-speed winches. Beyond that, slightly more forward is the companionway that leads down below deck. Walking down the stairs opens into the settee and galley which both have all wood flooring. The galley is equipped with a large refrigerator and freezer unit, Tappen microwave oven, and fully gimbaled stove with large oven and two burners. Behind the galley and underneath the cockpit is a large stateroom with king sized bed and door to stall shower and head. Back in the settee and next to the galley is the navigation station which comes with all the necessary equipment, most products are Raymarine. Forward and to port is another seating area which can be seen as an extension of the settee. Even more forward of that is a guest cabin with another stall shower and electric head.

results.ListingTitle: Like New, Low Hours, Well Maintained
GeneralBoatDescription:
• As close to new as you could find
  • One owner
  • Harbor cruising and short day trips giving only 45 hours on engines
  • 10 hours on Generator
  • Engines fire right up

Chaparral’s 290 Signature is a well-built, beautiful designed cruiser ideal for weekend cruising. Built on a modified–V hull with cored hull sides and a solid fiberglass bottom, modern design with interior cherry joinery, designer fabrics and upscale furnishings.

This cruiser is a one-owner boat with very low engine hours, well maintained and is like brand new - a fantastic buy at this low price.
AdditionalDetailDescription:
Manufacturer Provided Description

Taking full advantage of our patented Wide Tech technology, the 310 takes cruiser design to a high level with more style, more storage space, more cabin headroom and more performance than ever thought possible. Everywhere you look-the helm, transom area, even the galley Chaparral's spark of innovation shines. Topside, the 310's standard fiberglass hard top provides ultimate all-weather protection and is reminiscent of cruisers 10 feet longer and twice as expensive. In the cockpit, you get a feeling of total security wrapped in unmatched luxury. Two cockpit seating meet every need. Ultra refined, the 310 has a carefree single level cockpit,  helm seating and the finest workmanship imaginable. Below decks, the 310 is a marvel in space efficiency, elegance and workmanship. The aft cabin has considerably more inches of headroom than previous offerings.  An oversized LCD television is mounted on a swivel bracket for viewing in both the salon and forward berth. The lighter wood tones of our River Cherry cabinetry create an open and airy feeling. What really makes the 310 state-of-the-art is the phenomenal use of space. The filler cushion for the aft cabin is part of the backrest.

GeneralBoatDescription:
REVISED LISTING WITH PRICE REDUCTION

This very lightly used 2008 Hylas 46 center cockpit cruiser is in fabulous condition.  The proven German Frers design was built by Queen Long Marine, and this original owner made tasteful selections of interior and exterior options, which compliment the robust Hylas standard deck, mechanical, electrical, and plumbing systems. In addition, she has a custom Westerly Marine carbon fiber and safety glass Dodger and Bimini. The Bimini supports two adjustable solar panels.  For sailing convenience, she has a Schaeffer Gamma in-boom main furling system, which is run from a powered secondary winch, without interfering with the primary electric winches.

The interior is light and airy with large windows, custom teak cabinetry, raised panel doors, and a teak-and-holly sole. Ultra suede was used for all seating cushions.  She is LOADED with options.

results.ListingTitle: Open your mind, open your eyes.
GeneralBoatDescription:
Major Price Reduction!

                                                         2005 Azimut 68 S

This Turn Key Azimut 68 S’ has received great care. The owner grew up on a farm in Spain. Throughout those years, he learned the importance of taking care of the mechanical equipment and that “an ounce of prevention was worth a pound of cure.”  He has since always taken the utmost care of his possessions. 

 

The owner left the family farm to start a successful luxury marine and lifestlye business on the island of Ibiza. Over the years, He has owned several larger yachts which he uses to cruise the Mediterranean while sharing this passion for yachting with his loved ones.

Azimut being the largest producers of motor-yachts in the world,You will be sure that this beautiful Azimut 68 S is a safe and sound investment. 

Click the  "View full Specifications" tab above find out all the specs of this boat.. Here are a few key features of the boat:

  • The Master Cabin is downstairs and aft and is most spacious. The master has its own full shower and bathroom, as well as a dinette where you can sit and watch TV while having brunch. 
  • There is also a VIP Guest Cabin forward with its own shower and bathroom as well.
  • MTU engines with less than 200 hours
  • There is another Guest stateroom with two twin mattresses and has private access to another separate head plus shower.  
  • The spacious and relaxing Salon includes a large semi-circular seating area, an elegant sideboard facing a entertainment center.
  • The separate dining area is on the bridge deck, with outstanding visibility through the main screen and side windows.

 BONUS: The Owner wanted to keep it but finally decided to give you the  brand new 2015 Sea-Doo Spark Wave Runner to go along with the yacht!

I could keep going on about the nice parts of this boat, such as the surround stereo system,  new satellite TV and other nice features.

This fully loaded and turn key yacht has been reduced to EUR 650,000 which is amazing value for a Azimut of this age and caliber that has been so well kept and maintained.

So if you are serious about cruising in style this summer, the next step is for you to give me a call and arrange a visit.

Call me (Jacob) Now at: 1(786)566-0030 or simply email me at Jacob@DenisonYachtSales.com

Every once in a while you see a boat that is clearly one of a kind, the sort of boat that draws attention when sailing by or sitting in a quiet anchorage.  The D. Haus designed 68’ cutter Carita, is this kind of boat.  She is truly unique as she’s a custom boat built in San Pedro, California in 1970 and she has no sister ship unless someone makes a twin from the plans that still exist.  In 2006, she was bought and lovingly restored, and today she’s in like-new condition and drawing plenty of attention wherever she goes. Come see her today and be sailing with history tomorrow.

The vessel is in great operational condition with significant upgrades accomplished with superior craftsmanship. The vessel has full accommodations with three staterooms, two enclosed heads, and full galley.

GeneralBoatDescription:
Asking Price Includes all shipping and  delivery!

Owner is moving up to a larger Princess since him and his family absolutely loved and cared for this one so much. This Yacht has provided them with endless hours of joy at sea! With the second round of grandchildren getting bigger, They have to increase in size.  This Yacht is in pristine condition and is sure to turn heads wherever she goes. Simply put, This is an overall fantastic buy!

 

The Princess 68 is a breathtakingly beautiful craft. Her spacious flybridge includes a large sunpad, twin helm and a wetbar for on hand refreshment. On deck she provides ample entertaining space with both cockpit and foredeck seating and an inviting sunbathing area. Out at sea, her exhilarating performance feels light and responsive all the way up to speeds in excess of 30 knots. It’s an altogether distinctive experience!!
AdditionalDetailDescription:
Manufacturer Provided Description
A sleek, raked profile and raised bulwarks give the Princess 67 the feel of a much bigger boat. Sleeping six in style (eight with the optional aft crew cabin), the owner� suite and two guest suites all have bathrooms with separate stall showers. The spacious saloon, with its dining area and sunken galley, is an atmospheric environment for entertaining and can be opened to the cockpit to create one party area. The flybridge incorporates a sunbed, spacious seating and its own wet bar. With impeccable sea keeping, the Princess 67 puts high-speed distance cruising genuinely within reach.

GeneralBoatDescription: The 67 is the embodiment of the Princess flybridge yacht with a perfect balance of performance, efficiency and luxurious accommodation. Dine in her spacious cockpit or entertain on the flybridge with a well-appointed wet bar and dining area that can comfortably accommodate eight guests. No matter where you go, you will be sure to turn heads in this beautiful yacht. Owner is moving up so bring offers today! Call or email Jacob Knorr
AdditionalDetailDescription:
Manufacturer Provided Description
The Princess 67 incorporates the latest modified deep V hull design offering unparalleled sea keeping and performance, a soft ride and the capability for long range fast cruising. Spacious accommodation comprises a full-beam owner's stateroom, a further VIP stateroom forward and a two berth cabin to port as well as an optional cabin for crew or occasional guests. The main deck is beautifully crafted with three distinct areas aft of the lower helm. A fully equipped galley is situated beside a large separate dining area and a generous saloon fitted with an entertainment centre is separated from the cockpit with triple glass curved sliding doors. The Princess 67 is an outstanding motor yacht combining the very best in engineering, design, craftsmanship and style.

• Over 50k in recent upgrades

  • Come see to appreciate

With more than 600 launched, the Hatteras 53 is one of the most successful yacht designs ever built; PowerBoat Guide sums it up nicely by saying, "Some designs succeed so well in the marketplace that they earn the distinction of being industry classics. Such is the Jack Hargrave-designed Hatteras 53. Launched in 1969, she quickly became the standard by which other motoryachts were measured; two decades in production, she's still a popular yacht whose comfortable ride and generous accommodations have seldom been equalled". And just this month (December 2007) both Motor Boating and Yachting magazines included the Hattie 53 on their lists of the 12 best designs of all time; they note respectively that the "spacious and comfortable Hatteras 53 is a true classic with ageless lines and a seaworthy hull" and "Jack Hargrave is at his best on the Hatteras 53".

GeneralBoatDescription:
The Albin 43 is a solidly built trawler with two staterooms, two heads, and twin Ford Lehman diesel engines.  It is fuel efficient, comfortable, and would make a great liveaboard.

This boat shows well and comes in a wonderful end tie slip that may be transferable to the new owner (subject to marina approval.)
AdditionalDetailDescription:
Accommodations

Built in Taiwan, the Albin 43 Trawler is a classic design with a flared bow, walk-around side decks, and a solid fiberglass semi-displacement hull.

It has a forward v-berth followed aft by a head & shower to starboard, and a galley to port.

The salon has an inside helm to starboard, followed by a convertible dinette.  There are large windows so it is light and bright, and port & starboard doors for access to the side decks.  The sole is teak parquet, and the paneling is teak throughout.

Continuing aft down two steps into the master stateroom you will find a queen bed, and a private head & shower.  Again there is teak cabinetry providing plenty of storage.

At sea, the ride is stable, and the twin Lehman engines power the boat to an 7 knot cruise with a range of around 900 miles.

Additional

New helm cushions.

New holding tank.

Brightwork done.  (Plus a set of canvas covers to protect it.)

New refrigerator.

Aft bank of 2 x 6 gel starter batteries.

Wooden mast & boom.

Spare anchor.

Both engines & generator regularly serviced.  (Heat exchangers serviced March 2016.)

Manufacturer Provided Description
Individual, aesthetic, efficient, and perfectly balanced: the Venezia 42. The futuristic "cap" in the roof is a sunshade which eliminates the greenhouse effect inside the boat and shields fabrics and woodwork from the deteriorating affect of UV rays. Colours, shapes, materials - all are ingredients for the successful alchemy of the Venezia interior design. One of its finer points must be the unusually spacious hulls, with four double cabins. Galley and chart table are both in the saloon to take advantage of the superb all-round view. Every Fountaine Pajot is built to the highest ISO 9002 European standard for offshore yachts, incorporating vacuum-bagging construction and careful hand lay-up with sophisticated high-strength isophthalic resins, which results in an extremely high strength-to-weight ratio. The keels are fixed fins, and filled with foam, protecting the rudders and shafts. Should they strike a reef or submerged object they harmlessly break away without allowing water intrusion. Fountaine Pajot catamarans use nets forward and eliminate weight in the forward hulls to prevent pitching and aid bow recovery in heavy seas. Electric windlasses are used not only for hauling in the anchor, but also for hoisting the main.

GeneralBoatDescription:
34' | Cal 34 Sloop | 1970

The ideal boat for your next SoCal sailing adventure!

Pura Vida’s owner reluctantly parts with this true sailor’s Cal 34. Designed and build just a few dozen miles form where Pura Vida is berthed in Marina del Rey, Cal 34s are the ideal SoCal sailboat, whether for a day sail with friends on Santa Monica Bay or an overnight or week-long trip to Catalina or beyond. Stoutly built of thick hand-laid fiberglass, Cal 34s are known to make ocean crossings, and with apprx. 40% ballast/displacement ratio, they are stiff and controllable in wind gusts.

The Cal 34’s naval architect, Bill Lapworth – whose signature graces Pura Vida’s forepeak! – designed these boats as excellent light air performers yet able to handle California’s strong offshore westerly breezes. Pura Vida’s owner frequently attained 6 knots of boat speed on just 10 knots of wind on the way to Catalina, yet often did not reef the main until sustained winds hit apprx. 18 knots. Pura Vida delighted her surfer-owner with many lively beam-reach trips back from the island, her flat bottom, fin keel and spade rudder making her a controllable yet thrilling wave rider.

Pura Vida is set up for the single-hander. Her masthead rig with its 120% jib and fully battened main are so well balanced that wing-and-wing downwind runs are no problem. The high-quality Ullman sails are in very good condition, the jib is self-furling, and stowable lazy jacks make dropping the mainsail a cinch, yet can be tucked away when sailing. When Pura Vida’s current owner replaced the standing rigging, he installed oversize upper shrouds, ensuring safety and solid performance. The mainsail is sheeted aft, with cam cleat and oversize traveler from a Cal 40, ideal for the single-hander. Pura Vida’s 30 hp Atomic 4 gas engine is clean, quiet, extremely reliable and fuel efficient (≤ 1 gal/hr), and it has the power to push the boat through ocean conditions. The keel is molded to the boat – not bolted on – meaning almost zero leaks and little work for the bilge pump.

The Cal 34’s long cockpit makes a fine place to socialize at the dock, enjoy the company of friends or family while out on the water, or sleep outside at the island. A canvas cockpit cover keeps nighttime dew out of the cockpit for those who choose to sleep above deck. Down below is a unique wood-panel ceiling liner, a clean, well-kept galley with large ice box, handsome teak lockers and bulkheads, and a spacious dinette. The galley table drops down to make a double berth. With the dinette berth, V-berth and two quarter berths, Pura Vida can sleep 6.

Pura Vida has been well loved by her few owners. Her current owner, on a sailing trip at Catalina, met the couple who owned her from 1975-1995. And only one owner had her between then and when her current owner purchased her 10 years ago. Cal 34s are ideal boats for Southern California sailing, and Pura Vida is a special Cal 34, turnkey ready to give you years of sailing joy.

Call for more information or to schedule a showing today!

GeneralBoatDescription:
As close to new as you will find.  Purchased in 2015 and lightly used.  Loaded with options:

  • In Mast Furling

AdditionalDetailDescription:
Manufacturer Provided Description

The Award-Winning Hunter 33 is a stunning New sailing yacht. Hunter's signature window line gives this yacht the sleek feel of the latest Hunters, but the improvements don't end there. The hull design has been improved, featuring a wider beam further aft as well as a more profound bow hollow. The result of this hull design is a longer dynamic waterline, which means more speed. The deck features a sleek, modern profile with large side windows allowing for increased interior light. The deck hatches are flush-mount, offering an enhanced look that complements the new profile. Lengthening the cockpit has allowed the new Hunter 33 to have a cockpit that is longer than its predecessor. The cockpit of the Hunter 33 also features a fold-down swim platform that extends the already lengthy cockpit when folded down while the boat is docked or at anchor.

Extending the cockpit allows for a larger master aft cabin that features more headroom. Overall, the interior has been enhanced with a richer look and feel. Enhancements start at the sole of the interior which features a hardwood flooring look that accentuates the true beauty of the Hunter 33's interior. Corian galley countertops feature complementing stainless steel fiddles that not only keep items from falling off the countertops in a seaway but also serve as excellent hand holds when moving about below. The interior wood used for the bulkheads as well as cabinet doors has been rotated 90 degrees so that the wood grain runs horizontally instead of vertically. Not only does this add a crisp modern touch to the interior, it also gives the eye the impression of a larger interior space.

The salon features several intelligent enhancements. To starboard, the comfortable settee features a center section that easily flips up to create a convenient chart table. The beauty of this sytem is its robust design...and no moving parts to wear out! To port, the elegant dinette sports Hunter's unique Easy Lift system. With a few simple cranks, the dinette table lowers to form the base of a double sleeper sofa. Above, near the overhead, Hunter has thoughtfully provided flat, fiddle-protected cabinet tops that supply even more storage space.

With its iTech option, The new Hunter 33 introduces built-in state of the art internet connectivity and enhanced entertainment capabilities to everyday sailors like you. The Hunter 33 iTech option features an Apple TV module, iTech docking station, built-in HDMI and USB cabling. Also available on the new Hunter 33 is a cell phone booster antenna system with 30-mile range.

In the salon, the port side settee features Hunter’s unique easy flip navigation table. One effortless flip reveals Hunter’s apple iTech docking station – your gateway to music, television programming, and blockbuster movie hits. Your iphone or ipod slips securely into this dock, and your ipad can easily cable into this port as well. This dock will charge your Apple devices, but that’s just the beginning. Play your favorite songs from your iphone or ipod itunes library both in the salon and in the cockpit, no matter where you are on the water.

Watch videos from your iphone or ipod itunes library on the 23” inch flat panel salon TV, even while at sea. If you have 3G reception or are docked in a wifi hotspot, you can stream web content to your TV and even watch full-length Netflix movies via your Netflix account. In addition, available separately, our cell phone booster antenna system will extend your 3G reception and transmission up to 30 miles beyond the normal signal range, so you can stay within cell phone range longer – for more entertainment, and greater safety.

The new Hunter 33 features built-in HDMI cabling ensures that the kids can connect their Xbox and Playstation and enjoy gaming for as long as YOU like. Choosing the iTech Option on the New Hunter 33 allows you to get away...while staying connected.

The Sea Ray Sundancer 470 is a sport yacht with sleek styling, sumptuous accommodations, and advanced power systems.  This boat is offered by its original owner and is in excellent condition.  Features include:

Twin Cummins QSB diesel 480hp engines

Zeus Pod Drives

Onan generator

Air conditioning

Skyhook Precision Pilot

Extended swim platform

Raymarine E140 radar / plotter

 

Call now to arrange a viewing!
AdditionalDetailDescription:
Key Features
  • Cummins MerCruiser QSB 480 Diesel Zeus drives.
  • Custom euro-style helm seat with flip-up, thigh-rise bolster, armrests, and heavy-duty pedestal with slide, swivel and pneumatic vertical adjustment, and fiberglass seat shell.
  • Companion bench with molded fiberglass storage.
  • Electrically actuated engine compartment hatch.
  • Sirius satellite receiver with antenna
  • 12V AM/FM single CD with six-disc CD changer, eight (8) speakers and digital cockpit remote control.
  • Zeus Drive System includes Skyhook Station-Keeper technology
  • U-Shaped aft seating with storage.
  • Cockpit wet bar with sink and faucet, solid-surface countertop, stainless-steel handrail, trash receptacle, and storage cabinet.
  • Standard LCD drop-down flatscreen TV with DVD in salon.
  • Innerspring mattress in forward stateroom.
  • Separate shower and head.
  • Ultraleather interior seating.
  • Generator with sound shield.
  • Underwater exhaust.
  • Large extended swim platform with heavy-duty stainless-steel swim ladder.

Accommodations

Starting forwards the master stateroom features an island queen berth with storage below, two hanging lockers and an en suite head to port, and shower to starboard.

Moving aft into the salon you will find the galley running along the port side, and an L-shaped convertible settee and entertainment center to starboard.  The galley has a glass-topped stove, a convection microwave, and a refrigerator / freezer.  A central vacuum system is found beneath the companionway stairs.

Continuing aft takes you into the guest stateroom which has twin berths that can be converted into a double, a head / shower, and a separate vanity / sink.

Immaculate Motor-yacht Now Available for a limited time in Southern California!

  • Custom marble counter-tops throughout galley, lower helm and flybridge.

  • This Yacht is a true Must see to appreciate her beauty both inside and out!

                                                           Bring All Offers Today
AdditionalDetailDescription:
Tarrab Yachts

The shipyard has been producing yachts for more than 55 years and today is a world wide leader premier builder of fiberglass yachts ranging in size from 40' to over well over 125'.

All Tarrab Yachts are constructed of solid fiberglass on a custom and semi-custom basis utilizing outstanding Old World craftsmanship and only the high quality U.S. parts and components.

All Tarrab Yachts are designed to provide the ultimate in comfort. All models feature wide beams and low centers of gravity to provide outstanding accommodations and to enhance stability in a seaway. Multiple structural bulkheads incorporated into the designs provide the basis of an extremely strong hull structure for greater safety. In addition, all systems are designed for serviceability and redundancy for increased reliability.

If you are looking for a strong, quality motoryacht, built with Old World craftsmanship with high quality components that will provide you with years of safe, reliable operation, see how Tarrab Yachts can meet your personal requirements!

Layout and Features

Expansive Room is what this yacht boasts, 3 stateroom, (Master state room is a full king-size walk around bed with large amount of storage and full cedar lined closet)  (Front VIP is a queen berth with full cedar lined closet) 3 ensuite heads, Master is equipped with Jacuzzi Tub and Shower, marble countertop, while the other staterooms have a very large shower, marble counters and electric heads. Once up top you will notice a full dining room for 6 along with a premium well appointed Galley featuring Sub Zero refrigerator and separate freezer.  Other Galley items include dishwasher, garbage compactor, convection oven, double stainless sink, Upgraded electric infrared stove top burner system and plenty of storage, massive upgraded marble countertop that expands over the helm and bridge seamlessly.

Description

Fine and premier Birdseye maple wood is appointed throughout this yacht, truly showing the craftsmen who passionately took over 18 months to complete the tooling.  Sitting comfortably in the salon you will notice all electronics hidden throughout the cabinetry with an expansive 46 inch LED TV with direct TV DVR connected in hidden wall unit featuring a Bose home entertainment system.




Appointed elegant Victorian furnishings with the finest fabrics from Europe, looking over the in Enormous Birdseye Maple and bronze mirror bar sets for a beautiful entertaining space for all to enjoy.

GeneralBoatDescription:
Rare opportunity!

CHE - Sunreef 114 - High Performance SuperYacht,  capable of 20 knots under sail, thanks to streamlined contours, narrow, sleek hulls and aerodynamic forms, all contributing to make this yacht sea kindly, fast, and comfortable. Luxurious appointments together with performance sailing ability make CHE one of a kind.

Thanks to a long and deep keel, and low free board, the vessel will track well up-wind and easily increases speed with apparent wind. Another feature contributing to the optimal speed factor are the impressive sail surfaces, built of D4 material.

CHE is outfitted with convenience and advanced technology features to make handling, maneuvering, and ocean crossings easy. She boasts a full Furuno Navnet 3D navigational system.
AdditionalDetailDescription:
Accomodations

Main Deck- “Wet Deck”.

The salon houses a large dining area for 8 guests comprising a sofa and large dining table and a separate lounge area housing a smart coffee table and storage cabinets. To starboard, alongside the dining area, is a spacious and fully equipped professional galley with ample storage, separated from the saloon by a glass wall and wood blinds, ensuring guest intimacy. A large 1080 Full HD LED Samsung TV is installed on the glass wall offering great entertainment for charter guests. The front section on the right features an internal helm station equipped with a full suite of navigation equipment and two captain’s chairs. Panoramic windows run alongside the wet deck providing natural light and stunning views. Wet deck interior space: 60m2

Lower Deck - Port hull:

Aft section and Midships:

  • Guest cabin with twin beds featuring 32' LED TV with en-suite head and separate shower stall.
  • Extra guest cabin with additional Pullman bed and ensuite head

Bow section - Crew's quarters

  • Captain cabin in the center
  • Crew cabin with twin beds
  • Crew saloon with sofa, dinette table, TV and storage
  • Crew bathroom with independent toilets and shower
  • Extra crew cabin with 2 bunk beds in fore-peak accessible from outside

Crew quarters are placed by the helm station and the galley which guarantees easy and quick access to these two most important work places.

Lower Deck - Starboard hull:

Aft section:

  • Twin guest cabin provided with 32" LED TV, extended storage and ensuite head and separate shower stall.
  • Larger storage with spacious fridge, wine cellar and extended storage

Bow section and Midships – Owner suite with private access

Spacious owner suite with LED 37' TV and DVD, twin beds with night tables, large desk facing panoramic windows, full size wardrobes, book shelves, large mirror. En suite head with separate shower stall and toilets, his and hers sinks, storage cabinets.

Exterior access only: One extra crew cabin with head. Port fore-peak.

 

EXTERIOR:

Cockpit

  • Spacious dining area with large dining table and settee to Starboard.
  • Intimate lounge area to Port.
  • Huge aft lounge area over the Tender Garage.
  • Large aft platform for the main tender
  • Extended storage for diving equipment and water toys
  • Easy access to water from twin swim platforms via hydraulic step ladder
  • Cockpit surface:103 m2

 

Flybridge

  • Main helm station with full navigation equipment and all sail controls
  • Dining area with settee and spacious table.
  • Extensive Sun Pads
  • Flybridge surface: 55m2
