GeneralBoatDescription:
The C&C 121 is a 40-foot racer / cruiser with a fin keel and spade rudder.  It has a spacious interior, with two cabins and a single head, while outside there is a large cockpit and plenty of storage.

Ullman Fiberpath sails.

B&G ZeusTouch electronics.

Volvo engine & saildrive.
AdditionalDetailDescription:
Accommodations

- Forward cabin with lockers, hanging locker and shelved storage

- Hinge-up under V-berth storage

- Over-length V-berth (76" L x 66" W) for added comfort set low for easy access

- Bunk-length main cabin settees fitted with contoured cushions

- Water resistant storage in main cabin seatbacks accessed through gasketed doors

- Furniture-grade bunk cushions

- Main cabin has cherry cabinets throughout

- 6' 4" (1.93 m) headroom in main cabin

- Full navigation station, finished in varnished cherry

- Navigation locker with storage space for extensive electronic installations

- Aft double berth (75" L x 60" W)

- Storage below aft double berth

- On-deck LPG storage well

- Helm seat storage

- Large cockpit lazarette on starboard

Electronics

B&G ZeusTouch displays x 2

Wifi networked / NMEA2000

Navpod with B&G wind / speed / depth display at companionway

Radar mount w/ NEW Simrad radar transmitter.

Raytheon below deck autopilot

Sails & Rigging

Ullman Fiberpath main on Antal Battcar system so hoisting is easy!

Ullman Fiberpath foresail on Selden Furlex 200S below deck furler.

UIlman Code 1-A in a sock.

Retractable bowsprit pole.

Rod rigging.

2 x Harken 44 2-speed halyard winches

2 x Harken 48 2-speed jib winches

2 x Harken 53 2-speed main winches

Simpson-Lawrence windlass (no anchor or chain.)

Hull & construction

• Hull construction is a vinylester laminate vacuum bagged with CoreCell core laminate locally reinforced with carbon fiber. 

• The vacuum-bagging process and strict resin control through use of resin impregnators
produces a hull laminate with 65% glass reinforcement content.

• CoreCell closed cell linear polymer foam coring is used for maximum impact resistance,
stiffness, strength, and light weight. The cored hull also offers superior hull insulating properties, both thermal and acoustic.

• The laminate in the keel area is reinforced with multiple plies of high-tensile carbon-fiber
unidirectional reinforcements

• Premium grade gelcoat provides superior gloss, fade resistance, and resistance to surface crazing.

• Interior is completely painted out for enhanced cosmetics and to seal interior laminate surfaces

Deck

 Deck is a balanced composite laminate utilizing vinylester resin, uni-directional "E"-glass reinforcement, and high strength/stiffness Baltek premium AL 600 balsa coring

- Deck is locally reinforced at high load areas with additional plies of bi-directional "E"-glass reinforcement

- White non-skid

- Premium grade gelcoat provides superior gloss, resistance to fading, and resistance to crazing

- Deck coring windows are located at all hardware installations to maintain the watertight integrity of the deck coring

- Molded in aluminum backing plates on all highly loaded deck hardware

- Hull to deck joint is secured with 1/4-20 stainless machine screws installed on 4" centers through the full-length 6061 T6 aluminum backing plate imbedded in the hull flange. This method exceeds the recommended installation requirements of the ABS scantling for offshore sailing yachts.

- Hull to deck joint is sealed with 3M 5200 adhesive sealant

- Composite light RTM match-molded deck locker hatches assure strict thickness controls allowing accurate gasket seal of cockpit openings. Conventional construction uses single-sided moldings with painted raw fiberglass underside.

- Double lifeline gate at transom

- Instrument pod integrated onto coach roof with convenient wire chase for instrument installations or additions

Keel & Rudder

39% ballast/displacement ratio

- Keel design features extremely low center-of-gravity (CG) bulb-design that produces overall VCG below designed waterline for extraordinary stability, safety, and sail-carrying ability

- Keel attached to hull with stainless steel bolts

- Epoxy-coated antimonial lead provides maximum stability

- Deep Draft 8 Foot Keel

- Elliptical, foam-cored rudder blade with uni-directional E-glass skins

- NASA high lift, low drag rudder section for maximum control and performance

- Rack & Pinion steering system with 48-inch Commodore wheel offering excellent visibility both under sail and under power

- Oversize 304 stainless steel rudder post

Interior

 - Structural fiberglass longitudinal and athwartship grid bonded to hull and deck, utilizing high-strength epoxy adhesives and Plexus methylmethacrylate adhesives providing superior structural bonding of key components vs. conventional production construction techniques.

- Aerospace adhesive technology used in the attachment of internal furnishings to further stiffen the overall structure

- Bulkheads and risers are pressure laminate or cherry-faced plywood

- Ventilated, solid-stock varnished cherry panel locker doors with push button latch sets provide fixed latching for security in a seaway

- Varnished cherry drop-leaf main cabin table to take up minimum interior space when not in use

- Ventilated panel varnished cherry passage doors with high quality locking latch hardware. Doors are mounted in laminated cherry doorframes

- Light weight composite construction utilized in lockers and cabinets

- Curved laminated cherry locker and cabinet trim

- Cabinets and trim are varnished cherry

- Cherry hull trim in forward cabin

- Lockers and cabinets are finished throughout and do not show raw fiberglass, plumbing, electrical runs or raw plywood edges

- Cabin sole is varnished teak and holly with bilge maintenance access lift out with lift ring

- Low maintenance FRP overhead

- Varnished cherry interior house side trim doubles as a full-length hand hold

- Companionway handholds

- Angled and teak companionway steps offer non-slip surface and security in a seaway

- Two-color interior gelcoat finish, cabins in sandstone, head and overhead in bright white

Galley

- 4-Burner Force 10 LP gas gimballed propane stove with oven and Microwave

- Remote sniffer and LPG shut off

- 9" deep stainless steel, double galley sinks and Granicote solid surface countertops

- Storage under galley sink through ventilated varnished cherry door

- Molded REFRIGERATOR with Granicote solid surface countertop. Four inches of insulation, 2 top access door and 1 side access door.
- Issotherm 12V DC refrigeration with a partition plate

- Hot and cold pressure water with easy service access to pump and plumbing

- Freshwater plumbing features polyethylene tubing and Whale mechanical fittings

- All below-water hose connections are double-clamped for added security

- Premium marine grade hoses throughout

- Extensive lockers and shelves

- 80-gallons (302.83 l) freshwater in custom-built aluminum tanks, two-tank system with selection manifold

- Forespar marelon thru-hull fittings throughout, UL approved and corrosion free

- 6 gallon (27.7 l) stainless steel water heater, operates on 110 VAC on engine near exchanger

Head

- Sealand Vaccu-flush head with 20-gallon (75.71 l) holding tank with deck pump out

- Marine premium grade sanitation hoses with low odor permeability

- Separate shower stall with plexi-glass enclosures and molded seat

- Shower in head with drain to sump and automatic pump

- Pull-out premium grade head faucet for shower

- Molded Granicote solid surface sink and countertops

- Ample storage in upper vanity and sink locker through low-maintenance ventilated access doors

Mast & Boom

- Charleston Spar Aluminum

- Black Awlgrip-coated triple-spreader design

- Tapered airfoil swept-back spreaders eliminate need for running backstays

- Custom aluminum masthead includes sheaves for 2 headsail halyards, 2 main halyards and a crane for two spinnaker halyards

- Rod rigging

- Internal halyards

- Mast-to-deck turnbuckle to carry running rigging loads

- Custom stainless steel chain plate system ties to extensive internal FRP structure and hull

- Masthead anchor light

- Steaming light with foredeck illuminator

- VHF wiring for masthead antenna

- Spartite mast-sealing and chock system

- Roller-furling with furling line led aft to cockpit

- Below deck stainless steel stem tang to allow low mount furling drum to maximize headsail luff

- Bridge Height Clearence 61' 6"

 

- Super durable black powder-coated aluminum boom

- Single-line slab reefing led aft, one line for tack and clew

- Internal 4:1 outhaul led aft to housetop winch and stopper

- (3) Sheave outboard boom-end custom welded fabrication

- (3) Sheave inboard boom-end custom welded fabrication

- Solid boom vang with control line led aft to cabin top

Deck Hardware & Rigging

- (2) Harken 53.2 Self-tailing primary winches

- (2) Harken 44.2 Self-tailing cabin top winches

- Deck organizers on cabin top to accommodate 10 aft sail control leads, lead to individual rope clutches

- Custom-fabricated, highly-polished stainless steel stem plate with integral mooring line chocks

- Bow and stern mooring cleats

- 24-inch tall double stainless steel bow and stern rails

- 24-inch tall stainless steel stanchions with double lifelines

- C&C custom stainless steel stanchion bases designed for maximum strength and to provide maximum on-deck passage area

- Boarding gates port and starboard with pelican hooks

- Double transom boarding gate with pelican hooks

- Molded foredeck anchor locker with overboard drain

- C&C custom black-anodized aluminum toerails

- Harken ball-bearing adjustable genoa tracks and cars with adjustment lines led to cockpit

- (2) Winch handles

- Harken mainsheet traveler in cockpit just fwd of wheel with tagline adjustment

- Custom-fabricated stainless steel mast collar with stainless halyard organizer plates

- Harken deck turning blocks for aft-led halyards

- On-deck drains to waterline outlet

- All Harken deck running gear for low friction and ease of use

- Lewmar Ocean Series size 60 aluminum foredeck hatch

- (2) Lewmar Ocean Series size 30 aluminum main cabin vent hatch

- (2) Lewmar size 10 vent hatch

- Large Lexan sliding companionway hatch on aluminum and delrin glides offers light and ventilation to cabin

- Marine grade polymer lockable companionway hatch board.

- Cabin top stainless steel handrails

- Manual bilge pump mounted in cockpit

- Offshore-ready, match-molded, gasketed cockpit hatch

- Molded companionway seahood with instrument pod

 

 

- (1) Low stretch genoa halyard

- (1) Low stretch main halyard

- (2) Dacron genoa sheets

- (1) Dacron mainsheet

- (2) Traveler taglines

- (2) Adjustable genoa track taglines led to cockpit

GeneralBoatDescription:
A WINNER ON ALL COUNTS

The target set for architect Umberto Felci and the Dufour Yachts Design Office was to come up with something even better than the Dufour 40. What a challenge! And they more than came up with the goods!

Its many qualities speak for themselves : finesse, precision, exciting sailing.

Take a look at :

  • cruising/racing deck layout, suitable for sailing with a full or reduced crew, out on the open sea or between two buoys;
  • below decks, the refinement and quality of Dufour Yachts’ interiors.

All adding up to a fast boat for racing or just for the pleasure of skimming through the water; which at the same time lets you enjoy proper cruising in comfort.

Manufacturer Provided Image: Dufour 40E Performance Galley
Manufacturer Provided Image: Dufour 40E Performance Cabin
Manufacturer Provided Image: Dufour 40E Performance Lower Deck Layout Plan

AdditionalDetailDescription:
Manufacturer Provided Description

The target set for architect Umberto Felci and the Dufour Yachts Design Office was to come up with something even better than the Dufour 40. What a challenge! And they more than came up with the goods!

Its many qualities speak for themselves : finesse, precision, exciting sailing.

Take a look at :

  • cruising/racing deck layout, suitable for sailing with a full or reduced crew, out on the open sea or between two buoys;
  • below decks, the refinement and quality of Dufour Yachts’ interiors.

All adding up to a fast boat for racing or just for the pleasure of skimming through the water; which at the same time lets you enjoy proper cruising in comfort.

Hull
  • Hull: Hand-laminated in polyester/glassfibre; sides made from
    vacuum-bonded PVC foam core sandwich.
  • Decoration: Decorative grey stripes on hull.
  • Gelcoat: NPG gelcoat with first mat impregnated with NPG resin
    forming an optimum barrier against osmosis.
  • Structure: Hull bottom counter-moulded, floors laminated into the hull.
  • Deck: Sandwich with injected PVC foam core
  • Ballast: Keel bolts bear on stainless back-plates
  • Rudder:Semi-elliptical shape, filled with closed-cell epoxy foam.
  • Rudder stock:Solid stainless steel.
  • Steering: Self-aligning roller bearings with ball-bearing sheaves
  • Non-slip deck surface: Non-slip structured deck surface.

Deck
  • Shroud chain-plates: Single stainless chainplate for cap shrouds/aft
    lower shrouds, including an eye for fixing extra control lines.
  • Safety chainplates: Safety harness chainplates in cockpit floor
  • Chainplates: Asymmetrical spinnaker tack ring forward of forestay
  • Midships mooring cleats: 2
  • Mooring cleats: 4
  • Rubbing strips: 6 stainless, on hull sheerline
  • Fuel deck fillers: 1
  • Water deck fillers: 2
  • Mainsheet tracks: On cockpit floor with car adjustment lines.
  • Genoa tracks: With plunger cars.
  • Pulleys:2 genoa sheet return pulleys with built-in jamcleat and
    attachment plate for spinnaker fly pulley.
  • Through-deck fitting: Stainless, for electrical cables, swan-neck.
  • Deck organizers: 2 deck organizers for halyard returns.
  • Halyard winches: 2 halyard winches on cabin roof.
  • Sheet winches: 2 Genoa sheet winches
  • Jamcleats: 2 rows ofjamcleats port/ starboard level with the companionway
  • Furler line jamcleats: 1 at aft end of sidedeck
  • Hatch covers: Polyester hatch cover forward of the companionway

Cockpit
  • Cockpit bench seats: Slatted teak
  • Lockers: 2 large side lockers, lids with fixing for padlock.
  • Helm: 2 steering wheels
  • Helm console: 2, aluminium
  • Engine control: Engine control panel and lever to starboard
  • Compasses: 2 on coaming aft .
  • Gas locker: On port side.
  • BIB locker: “Life raft stowage in dedicated locker in cockpit, aft.”
  • Shower: Cold water.
  • Shore supply: Socket to stbd in cockpit
  • Cockpit floor: Cockpit floor in polyester, slightly concave, with solid
    wood toe-boards
  • Emergency tiller: Head of rudder stock beneath helmsman’s floor for
    fitting the emergency tiller

Galley
  • Configurations: L-shaped on port side of companionway
  • Worktop: In GCorian®C synthetic resin with wooden fiddle.
  • Sink: Stainless, twin bowls with Corian®C synthetic resin covers,
    one of which can be used as a chopping board
  • Water: Hot and cold pumped water with chrome-plated brass
    single-lever mixer tap.
  • Gas cooker: 2-burner cooker with oven on gimbals, with stainless rail
  • Crockery storage: Dowels to retain crockery when heeling.
  • Refrigerator access: From side and via the worktop.
  • Storage
    - 3 closed cubby-holes
    - Under sink with waste bin
    - Outboard lower unit with cutlery drawer and sliding vegetable
    baskets.
    - With 3 sliding Plexiglas bins, with bottle rack under floor.
  • Waste bin: Sort compartments
  • Other: Light and ventilation provided by an opening port and ceiling
    lights over galley.

Rigging and Sails
  • Mast: Anodized aluminium with 2 levels of swept spreaders
  • Rigging: 9/10 fractional
  • Mast stepping: On keel.
  • Lights: Anchor and masthead lights.
  • Topping lift: Boom topping lift cleat.
  • Boom: Anodized aluminium fitted with 2 quick-reefers.
  • Standing rigging: Discontinuous in single-strand and Dyform*
    stainless cable, chrome-plated bronze rigging screws, comprising:
    forestay, backstay, cap shrouds, inter and lower shrouds.
  • Mast collar: Aluminium, with synthetic gasket and halyard return
    pulleys.
  • Backstay: Backstay adjusted with stay tensioner.
  • Running rigging: Running rigging in pre-stretched textile
    (Dyneema available as option), including: main and genoa halyards,
    boom topping lift, main and genoa sheets, mainsheet car and downhaul
    adjustments, reef lines and furling line.

Engine Notes
1 x 40hp

GeneralBoatDescription:
2016 pricing still available...

Now take advantage of the strong dollar

Introducing Privilège Serie 6….a modern era 64' Power Catamaran based on strong character.

Famous naval architect Marc Lombard and his design office, the ML Design Team have reached the incredible…

Style, Range, Performance and Safety!

Naval Architect Marc Lombard quotes:

“Our desire is to offer a real alternative in the motor-yacht catamaran market. Some traditional trawlers reached the market recently but nothing really different. It was essential to bring a new point of view on the concept and the cruising program.

Aesthetically speaking, her modern and distinctive shape is especially based on the Motor Yacht spirit rather than on sailing catamarans adapted to power….”

Style….Power and refinement on two hulls will suit:

--  Those who dream about stability at anchor and about comfort in rough seas,

-  Those who demand the space of larger yachts with personal customization,

-  Those who imagine having both, Privilege elegance and reliability.

Range and Performance….Two versions

Sport Version - cruise over 27 knots.

Cruise Version -cross oceans and still capable of 20 knots.

Safety…Bureau Veritas: your guarantee

The global leader in Testing, Inspection and Certification.

Privilege Marine is the only shipyard to have signed an agreement with BUREAU VERITAS based on regular visits and inspections. Every Privilege Furio 6 owner receives an individual certificate issued by BUREAU VERITAS

Contact the exclusive North American Privilege Dealer for more information.
AdditionalDetailDescription:

Furio thought for making life easy:

 Privilege Furio 6….Finally… Your Needs Fulfilled in a Motor Yacht Catamaran!

  • Shape designed specifically for exceptional handling and performance at sea and anchor

  • Owner cabin entire width of yacht offering accommodations of a large motor yacht with an expansive view of the sea

Manufacturer Provided Description
The Catalina 42 MarkII has earned an international reputation as the leader in her class. Design, cruising performance, and comfort, all make the Catalina 42 the first choice of sailors worldwide. The hull of the 42 MkII is high volume, and easily driven, with a fine entry, firm midship section, and smooth run aft terminating in a modified reverse transom with an uncommonly spacious and functional boarding platform. Each of the four different cabin arrangements feature varnished teak jointery, ash hull side paneling, excellent light and ventilation. This model is available in three layouts: the Three Cabin Pullman model offers two staterooms aft and the traditional placement of the owners stateroom and spacious head foward with stall shower; the Two Cabin Pullman model offers the traditional mid-ship placement of the owners stateroom and spacious head foward with stall shower; the Two Cabin Centerline model offers cruising couples an alternative v-berth configuration for the owners stateroom and forward head arrangement.

GeneralBoatDescription:
“High performance … sensible price” – Seahorse Magazine

The C&C 30 one-design high performance race boat offers the thrill and technology of big-boat grand prix sailing in a size that’s fun, easy to sail and affordable. No other contemporary offshore capable race boat in this size range offers such proven grand prix features, sleek styling cues and ease of sailing at such a great value.

The C&C 30 combines a stiff, slippery-fast hull, a powerful sail plan, and ultra high-tech construction and materials, with an uber efficient deck layout inspired by the TP52 class. Plus, the boat is also a featherweight flyer that’s tough enough to stand up to the rigors of middle-distance offshore racing too. The fun is just beginning.

GeneralBoatDescription:
THIS IS A SLICK MODERATE HULL THAT SHOULD BE FAST AND HAVE NO BAD MANNERS.
– SAILING MAGAZINE

With winning performance in its genes, the Redline 41 is a powerful racer and cruiser that is inspired by, and takes its name from, one of C&C’s most successful racer/cruisers in the early 70’s—the Redline 41. But that’s about all this ultra-high tech offshore performance boat has in common with its predecessor.

The newly designed stiff, light-weight hull is built of high-tech composites to strict ISO Category A standards. The carbon fiber mast is tall and powerful. The deep, cast iron fin with a lead bulb keel provides significant stability without adding excess speed stealing drag. And nearly every aspect of the boat is customizable to your specific wants. Hardcore racers will be able to keep it light and as fast as any 41 footer out there. And hardcore racers who want a bit more accommodations comfort can have that too.

AdditionalDetailDescription:
Description

The Bayliner 5288 Pilot House Motoryacht is a spacious, long-range, fully-featured pilothouse cruising yacht with three staterooms, yet it is still small enough to be handled by a couple.

Entry to boat is via the spacious swim platform. A step up takes you into the cockpit, which has a moulded fiberglass stairway up to the flybridge. That staircase also lifts up to provide access down into the engine room

Entering through sliding doors takes you into the salon. This has a sofa and table to starboard, and two chairs to port. Forward on the same level is the galley, which has a full sized refrigerator, an oven and microwave.

Up three steps takes you to the pilothouse which has a fully equipped helm surrounded by passenger seating. There are doors port and starboard leading out onto the wide side decks for easy docking.

Down a stairwell from the pilothouse takes you to the staterooms. The master stateroom is aft and features an athwartships bed with space to walk around both sides, a countertop with a sink, and a private head with a shower.

Forward through a short passageway you pass a guest cabin to port with over & under bunks, and a washer dryer. To starboard is a guest head with separate shower.

The VIP cabin is forward and features an island queen berth.

 

• (4) Zone Reverse-Cycle HT/AC: Salon 1 & 2, Master, VIP
• ASKO Stacked Apartment-Sized Washer and Dryer Units Vented
• Vacu-Flush Heads
• Central Vac System

EnginesTwo fresh-water cooled Man diesel engines provide 660 HP each. They have about 780 hours, and were gone though by Man 2012 with new valve kits to tune of around $30,000. They are in excellent condition and recent Oil samples showed normal wear.  Spare parts and tool box included.  You could have lunch in this spotless engine room.

15 k/W Westerbeke generator with 1540 hours.

GeneralBoatDescription:
Exceptionally well kept Apreamare Cabinato 12 Meter Hardtop.

This vessel is reminiscent of the Sorrento boats of the old country and made by Apreamare Yachts in Torre Annunziata, Italy.

The blending of Italian design, old world woodworking and the high tech laminates of fiberglass come together in this first class vessel with exceptional style, fit and finish.

This two stateroom two head vessel offers cruising luxury at its best.

The helm area is air conditioned and it offers a double wide helm seat to starboard with an L-shaped dinette to port.

There is a wet bar with a built in ice maker and refrigerator directly behind the helm seat.

Below decks the open salon has a guest stateroom to starboard and a spacious head to port.

Forward is another dinette to port and the well equipped galley to starboard.

In the bow is the master stateroom with a walk around queen bed, ample hanging lockers, drawers, cabinet storage and a spacious en-suite head with stall shower.
AdditionalDetailDescription:
Manufacturer Provided Description

The magnificent 12m has all the features - including a spacious salon, complete galley, plus 2 staterooms and 2 heads with separate shower stall - to please even the most particular connoisseur. 

Entering on the large teak swim deck you have stainless steel and teak ladders port and starboard,a Glendinning Cablemaster shore power machine and a cockpit shower. Moving forward into the cockpit area you have a large settee with large lazarette. The Glendinning Cable Master, Magnum Energy Inverter, trim tab pump, steering, and ample storage in this space. The decks are teak overlay on fiberglass decks, with no mechanical fasteners, the decks are chemically fastened with caulking to eliminate leaks. The teak decks are in great shape. The helm has a canvas and eisenglass back drop canvas from the aft end of the hardtop, this area has heating and cooling with Cruise Air reverse cycle air conditoning. There is a comfortable settee with a table that can be used at coffee table height or for lunch at the helm, the table raises and lowers hydraulic-electric.Just push a button and raise or lower the table. The engine room is below the helm teak sole and has ample room to do maintenance with an electrical oil change pump, Racor filters, both engines have filters on the inboard sides, and dripless packing on the shafts the engine room is dry and very tidy.The helm is to starboard with a double helm seat and electical opening hatches in the hard top above. The helm has great electronics including a new RAYMARINE C-90W with a plotter, radar, and reverse angle camera. The reverse angle camera is great to have when cruising you can just look down and see if anything is behind you. The yacht is equipped with a bowthruster for easy docking. Going forward port or starboard you have nice wide walkarounds and the fordeck has a large sunpad under canvas and a great anchoring area with a stainless steel anchor and two lazarettes. From the helm down the stairway you enter a large salon with a VIP stateroom to starboard and the VIP head to port with a shower. The L settee is to port forward of the VIP head and the galley is to starboard forward of wth VIP stateroom. The owners stateroom is forward with an island queen bed with storage below and the ensuite head with stall shower.


Recent Upgrades
Water Music has had the following recent upgrades

NEW Raymarine C90W Bundle Radar, GPS Chart Plotter, Depth Sounder, and Reverse Image Camera, with 18" digital radonme, trunnion mount

NEW Standard Horizon VHF/AIS RADIO

NEW KVH M1DX Satalite dome Dish Network

NEW Magnum 2000 watt Inverter with remote display/controller

NEW Batteries 5 4D Commercial plus one maintenance free bow thruster battery

NEW bow thruster propeller and zinc

NEW Trim Tabs with dual hydraulic rams (upgrade from one ram)

True Pitch and Balance Props; install with Prop Speed

Install Spur Line Cutters on both shafts

Clean, paint and detail engine room

Polish and wax hull and house

Clean and sand the teak decks


Electronics and Helm Equipment
The helm is very well laid out and has been upgraded since April 2011

Electronics

New Raymarine Bundle with Radar, GPS Chartplotter, Depth sounder, and reverse view camera.

New Standard VHF/AIS Radio-Telephone

Deck and Anchor System
The decks on this yacht are teak with no plugs and screws. The decks are chemically attached to the fiberglass decks to avoid leaks to the core. The decks are in great shape. The anchor system is forward with an electrical windlass and two opening anchor lockers port and starboard of the stainless steel Bruce type anchor. There is a large sunning pad forward of the windshield on the overhead of the salon and forward stateroom. This pad is under cover while underway.

Deck Equipment

Teak decks

Lofrans windlass with deck and helm controls

Polished stainless steel Bruce anchor

Anchor chain 150 feet

Large Sunning pad with canvas cover

Safe stainless steel rails port and starboard.


Electrical
Water Music is equipped with a Glendinning Cable Master with 125/250 VAC connectors for shore connection. She is equipped with a 15 KVA ACME isolation transformer located in the aft lazarette. When away from the dock she has a Muse 9,5 K.W. Genset with remote start/stop. She also has a new Magnum Energy 2000 watt Inverter with Magnum Energy Remote Display/Controller and Magnum Energy Battery Monitor for quiet 125 VAC power. She has 4 Cemmercial 4D lead acid batteries new in April of 2011, (2 engine start 2 house) . She has a seperate thruster battery (new 4D) and genset starting battery (Group 31) also new in April of 2011. She has custom 12 VDC and 125/250 VAC electrical panels in the salon.

Genset MUSE IS 9.5 SM 9.5 K.W. In a sound shield with 212 hours

Glendynning Cable Master

Isolation Transformer 15 KVA

Six Batteries new in April of 2011

New Magnum 2000 watt inverter

 


VIP Stateroom and head
The VIP is down the companionway stairs to starboard with a large double bed, hanign locker and ample drawer space. You can invite your friend and her husbund and they will feel iike special guests. The head is to starboard down the companionway and has a very innovative shower arrangement to keep the toilet and isn dry while showering. The Technu head is of the highest quality along with the fixtures in the head. This stateroom has a seperate 16,000 BTU Cruise Air unit for heating and cooling.


Owners Stateroom and Ensuite head and stall shower
The owner's stateroom is forward with an ensuite head and stall shower. The Technu tolilet is of high quality and the head fixtures match the quality of the toilet. The Island Queen Bed is extra length and has room for a tall person. The reading lights are well placed to allow one person to read while the other sleeps. This stateroom has a seperate Cruise Air 16,000 BTU reverse cycle air conditioning unit for heating and cooling.

Queen Island bed with memory foam

Engine Room and Lazarette

The engine room is below the cockpit sole with a large hatch access is great. The lazarette is aft under the large settee. The in-line six cylinder engines allow access on all sides of the engines and the genset is in a sound box with easy access from the top or sides. The tank maniforld for the fuel is on the forward bulkhead of the engine room and is very intuitive.

Galley, Salon, and Enclosed Helm


The GALLEY in Water Music is very efficient with a two burner cooktop, microwave oven, large 12VDC/120 VAC refrigerator/freezer. There is a large drawer bank and ample storage for cruising. The sink is ample to wash dishes and the area is very well laid out.

The SALON has a large L settee with Stereo CD and AM/FM tuner, flat screen television. The settee will make down to a large single berth. There is a seperate Cruise Air Conditioning (16,000 BTU) unit for heating and cooling in the salon. There is ample storage above and below the settee.

The HELM is a very comfortable area to run the yacht or have a cool drink while at the dock or at anchor. Equipped with a double helm seat and large "L" shaped settee. The Air Conditoning in this area, aft enclosure and hard top allow you to cool or heat this area as necessary. This area has a seperate 16,000 BTU Cruise Air unit for heating and cooling.

Broker's Comments
This yacht is reminiscent of the Sorrento boats of the old country (Italy) and made by Appreamare in Torre Annunzita, Italy. The blending of old world woodworking and high tech laminates of fiberglass come together in a first class yacht with exceptional styling, fit and finish. This twpo stateroom yacht is cruising luxary at its best. Topsides at the helm is a doublewide seat and "L" shaped guest seating to port and is air conditioned. A wet bar with refrigerator and icemaker plus aft bench seating and built in tables make for easy entertaining. Below decks the open salon has an "L" shaped seating to port across from the galley with a large refrigerator/freezer, stove top and microwave. There are lots of varnished teak cabinet and storage plus a head aft for guests and a private head and stall shower in the owner's stateroom. The Island Queen bed forward make this a wonderful master. Powered with twin 480 h.p. Volvo TAMD74P diesel engines the Cabinato 12 will cruise at 21 knots and top out at around 28 knots and will sip fuel at 10 knots (est. 8 gph)

GeneralBoatDescription:
Manufacturers Description:

A great daysailor, this well cared for and lightly used Alerion 28 is extremely well equipped to day sail and race. Standout features include Hoyt jib boom, Genoa tracks and cars, spinnaker gear, 2 spinnakers, and a new auto pilot. Not only good looking, she is a delight to sail. 

The Alerion sailing and ownership experience is all about pleasure and pride.  The Alerion Express 28 is customarily known as one of the most elegant boats on the water.  With a modern underbody, her performance is as stellar as her sharp looks.

With ample and comfortable cockpit and cabin, she is at your service for weekend couple's cruising or at impluse anytime.  She sleeps two in the V berth.  Carrying a very manageable sailplan with self tacking boom, she is also a lone sailor's dream.  Both traditional sailors and staunch racers are known to affirm the Alerion Express 28's beautiful balance and pleasurable sailing.

Fin keel, spade rudder, easily handled sailplan and Yanmar diesel affords reliable power, seakeeping and stability.
AdditionalDetailDescription:
Descriptions
Accommodations

The interior of the boat is in excellent conditon.  There is a large V-berth forward that can sleep two and a long settee on the port side of the cabin that can be another berth.  There is a new Marine head under the V-berth.  Overhead hatch above the V-berth provides plenty of ventilation and natural light.  On the starboard side of the cabin is a stainless steel sink with freshwater pump, a seat and then a chart table with storage under.  There is an Igloo cooler with a teak and holly lid that is strapped in place to serve as a step to the companionway and doubles as a seat for the chart table.

Engine access is excellent.  Teak and holly sole in the cabin is in top condition.  Dark blue cushions throughout the interior are in like new condition.  Complete set of white vinyl cockpit cushions are stored in the V-berth and look like new.  Cockpit has plenty of room for a crowd, storage compartments, lazarette and beautifully varnish teak cockpit coaming.

AdditionalDetailDescription:
Description
  • SAIL & ENTERTAIN IN “GRAND” STYLE
  • The Dufour 500 Grand Large adds a new dimension to your cruising adventures.
  • A powerful, yet easily managed sailplan delivers passionate performance in variety of conditions with plenty of cockpit space for larger groups to enjoy the ride in total comfort.
  • The unique, award WINNING interior layout provides an expansive social environment that’s perfect for entertaining family and friends in elegant style.
  •  SUPER SEATING Wide cockpit seats with high backrests easily accommodate larger groups in total comfort whether under sail or at the mooring.
  • The clean coaming top forms a secure step while moving to or from the ample side decks and also serves as an "upper " level of seating.
  • CONVERTIBLE SUNBED Lift up the bench side to create an expansive double sunbed.
  • A VERSATILE TABLE. The beautiful teak surface converts from convenience table with dual storage bins to a full dining space with refrigerator that adds easy access to refreshments under way.
  • A SKIPPERS DREAM Twin helm stations provide outstanding visibility and comfort with total control for the skipper
  • The contoured side deck provide a secure surface when heeled and the Electric primary winches are close at hand for the ultimate in singlehanded sailing capability.
  • Aft deck seats and folding benches on the stern door offer extra seating options.
  • ACCOMMODATION
  •  The spacious rear cockpit is organised in two separate spaces: an area for sailing and one for entertaining and relaxing.
  • The uncluttered deck, with integrated storage, offers a large open space.
  • Clean lines, unique design and innovative equipment, the 500 Grand Large offers absolute comfort.
  • Internally, the layout allows for three en suite double cabins, making her ideal for sailing with company or as a charter opportunity
  • The oak interior adds to the light and modern feel.
  • The Forward split linear galley continues the feeling of space and inclusion, allowing the chef to be included in the social activity around the large saloon table and seating.
  • The starboard side full length sofa provides additional seating.
  • The island forward berth allows space for a separate head and shower cubicle.
  • The luminous interior is emphasised by the numerous port lights and deck hatches; the luxurious feel continued by the silver leather salon seating.

GeneralBoatDescription:
This one owner boat has two staterooms, and a down galley, A full width aft cabin with a separate head and shower. Raised aft deck and roomy fly bridge this boat offers plenty of room for entertaining in comfort and style.

  • (2) 420 hp Caterpillars (300 hrs)

AdditionalDetailDescription:
Interior Accommodations

The layout features a two-stateroom/two-head arrangement divided by midship salon and galley. 

The main salon has an entrance companionway on each side and large cabin windows that allow for plenty of light. The salon is spacious with an L-shaped dinette aft to starboard. Forward and to starboard is the lower helm adjacent to the companionway and there is a small island sitting area adjacent to port. 

From the main salon you go down several steps to the U shaped galley with exceptional counter space, storage and built in appliances. Such as stove/oven, convection microwave and dishwasher. Forward and center-line is the designated space for a Subzero refrigerator and freezer. 

Forward of the galley features a large V-berth, head to starboard and hanging lockers to port. There are ample drawers and storage below the V-berth, headroom is well over 6' and there are opening ports and an overhead deck hatch for natural ventilation.

The master stateroom is aft of the main saloon and again down several steps. The aft cabin layout offers a queen-size island berth, a desk in the port aft corner and the head and shower are separated on each side of the forward entrance to the cabin.

GeneralBoatDescription:
If you have ever dreamed of taking a break and cruising off to the South Pacific, this is the boat for you.  After buying it new, the owner did just that, spending the last four years island hopping from sunrise to sunset.  During that time, he discovered everything that was needed to make such a journey possible and installed it on the boat.  It has new teak decks, a water maker, solar power, wind power, all kinds of electronics, and back-up upon back-up for every system...  Heck, he even installed wider steps on the swim ladder so his dog could climb aboard more easily.  

Now he has fulfilled his dream, he is moving on to new challenges, and so this boat has to find a new adventurer.  

Could that be you? 

 

Note: This vessel is held in an LLC which may offer tax advantages to a purchaser.

AdditionalDetailDescription:
Manufacturer Provided Description

The Maxum 4100 SCR, formerly the 3900 SCR, is a getaway yacht that's equally pleasurable to getaway in or to. At the helm station there's room for three, and a two-person port seat adds to command bridge passenger comfort. The foredeck is outfitted with a large sunlounge of zippered modules for easy storage, and side rails for added safety. Three skylights and an oval mirror above the V-berth illuminate the 4100 SCR's spacious interior. The practical galley features white Euro-cabinetry and the cool look of marble. A microwave is located conveniently above the three-burner stove and a spice rack accents the cooking area. There's even a drop down cabinet deep enough to accommodate large cereal boxes. Drawers are all finished with easy to clean laminate bottoms. Finishing touches include gray-colored Ultraleather, and golden maple flooring, recessed lighting, built-in entertainment electronics, and ergonomically engineered conversation spaces. The dinette converts to a berth and accordion doors establish privacy between the center berth and forward stateroom. The 4100 SCR eases quickly onto plane with minimal bowrise for stable, solid, and smooth progress even in head seas. Average standing headroom of six-foot, four-inches, spacious all-fiberglass heads, gourmet galleys, and ultraleather lounges that resist staining. Exterior lines comfort the eye with sophisticated Euro-styling while interiors are bright, light and inviting. From the custom stainless steel stanchions, to the quality construction methods, every detail contributes to owner comfort. The hull intake vent's elliptical shape matches the portlights, reinforcing Maxum's flowing lines. The intake vent cover is a custom-made fiberglass part embossed with the Maxum badge. Features Maxum calls standard (such as Bomar hatches and Avonite counters) are exceptional on yachts in this range. Maxum Sports Yachts have superior safety features such as sunpad side-rails, a bow step-down for working the anchor area, and lights at all level changes.

GeneralBoatDescription: This very popular vessel has a large aft cockpit allowing for easy access to the Yanmar 180HP diesel while keeping engine noise out of the cabin. The well appointed cabin has a midship office with desk and seat, this space also converts to a berth that sleeps two. The dinette table is on a hydraulic piston that allows for an easy conversion to a berth or lounging area. The spacious front v-berth sleeps two adults and is over 6'5" in length. The galley which includes a sink, refrigerator, inverter, microwave and a combination propane stove/oven. The marine head is standard with an electric flush toilet, glass vessel sink and shower. maneuvering is aided by bow and stern thrusters. Visibility is excellent thru the Diamond Seaglase windows which surround the salon. New Bottom Paint in 2013.  Recent professional mechanical service makes this turn key and ready to cruise.

GeneralBoatDescription: ‘Wanderlure II’ is a spectacular example of a well executed restoration of a John Alden design schooner! Her sail plan is that of a staysail schooner for ease of handling and the ability to fly many combinations of sails. The new decks are of one half inch Silver Bali. The galley features a propane stove with oven, well insulated ice box, stainless steel counters and leaded glass paneled counter storage.  Abundant light, ventilation, propane heat and sleeping up to four. With plentiful storage and larger water tanks this vessel is ready to go to sea.
AdditionalDetailDescription:
History

‘WANDERLURE II’ was launched in 1926 at the premier Richardson Boat Yard in City Island New York and brought out to Newport Beach California in 1927 by H.H. Larkin.  Having spent her life in Southern California until 1990 where she was brought to Puget Sound, where her current owners bought and took five years to completely restore her to better then new condition. A very capable vessel in any seaway she also had an impressive racing record in California from the 1920’s thru the 1980’s. Nine vessels were built to this John Alden design, including five schooners and four ketches.

Restoration

Varnished teak bulwarks, cap rails and transom were installed about 1970. Between 2000 thru 2005 she was rebuilt, reframed, refastened, recaulked with new Silver Bali decks installed and the cockpit rebuilt with new combings. The rest of the vessel was brought up to like new condition.

The interior was replaced in a traditional manner appropriate to the era with Honduras mahogany, leaded glass, stainless counters in the galley. A propane stove and a Dickinson propane bulkhead heater were installed in 2008.

Originally built with a gaff fore, she was changed to a staysail, along with a six foot taller foremast and a lengthening of the bowsprit. This was thought to have happened in the 1950’s. Bronze winches, Lofran DC chain/rode anchor windlass, varnished masts and a Perkins 4-108 diesel complete a spectacular vessel.

Construction
  • Planking; Honduras mahogany 1 1/8" caulked and payed
  • Fastenings; bronze #12,14 x 2 1/2" x 3" long above the water line
  • Fastenings; galvanized #12, 14 x 3 1/4" below the water line
  • Framing; original 2" x 2 1/2" steam bent white oak on 12" centers
  • Renewed framing of white ash was epoxy saturated, bent to shape and fastened to the hull
  • Main deck completely renewed over original 2" x 3" decking by addition of 1/4" plywood and 1/2" Silver Bali over plywood in epoxy, grooved and payed
  • Floors; 2 1/2" oak
  • Clamp; 1 5/8"
  • Shelf; 1 5/8" x 3" 
  • Bilge clamp; 1 5/8" x 2 1/2" 
  • Deck and House beams; 1 3/8" x 2 1/4"
  • Ballast keel; iron 10,000 lbs. 1 1/2" diameter keel bolts
  • Back bone; 8" wide x depth as necessary
  • Bulwarks; teak capped with teak

Deck

Sail hoisting; 

       Main               Two #10 Barient

       Formast          Three #10 Barient 

       Main Halyard  Merrimar #2

Anchoring;

                              45 lb CQR

                              25 lb Danforth (Two)

                              55' 5/16" Galvanized chain

                              200' 3/4" nylon rode

Accommodations

From the companionway enter the main cabin with the galley port accommodating the stove and oven.  The galley starboard features the sink and ice chest.  Moving forward the mainmast holds the folding table and to port and starboard are generous seating areas that can be used as berths.  On the port forward bulkhead is the Dickinson propane cabin heater and opposite to starboard on the forward bulkhead is a leaded glass storage cabinet.  Moving forward entering the forward cabin, the Electro Scan head is to port with hanging storage to starboard.  The large V-berth has shelves to either side.  Forward at the bow is the chain locker.

Rigging
  • Rigging; Stainless Steel 7/16" and 1/2" 1x19 wire
  • Mainstays; 1/2"  Head-stays; and all wire 7x19
  • All rigging swagged to loop mast then wrapped with sewn leather covers
  • Turnbuckles; 1/2" Bronze
  • Runners to rail cap; 3/8" wire
  • Masts are solid; mainmast is close grain fir; foremast is sitka spruce. Both approximately 6" diameter
  • Both masts and booms inspected, worked over and refinished.  7/8" Stainless steel track on masts

Electrical

  • All running lights renewed to meet current codes
  • All interior lighting renewed or reworked
  • Master three way main battery switch
  • Four 6 volt batteries
  • Fused switches

Sails and Canvas

GeneralBoatDescription:
"Relentless" is a 44 foot cutter rigged sailboat. She is cold molded cedar, sheathed with fiberglass, completed in 1988 and refurbished and updated in 2013. 

Her owners have recently completed a summer tour in the Puget Sound and BC and have her ready for any adventure. They precisely set the boat up to be economic, easy to use for a couple, and updated to be a modern, yet classic cruiser. 

Relentless is also fast. At 20,000lb displacement, she is 3-5k pounds lighter than the Hunters, Catalinas and Beneteaus of this size range. She also has a great deal of sail area (943 SqFt of Main and Genoa). On our short sea trial out of Anacortes she performed admirably in very, very light air. 

This McGuire 44 has lots of upgrades. Read the full listing, but they include:

  • New Volkwagen engine, 65HP with 650 hours, which burns only 1.12 gal/hour at 7 knots,
  • New Simrad electronics in 2013, including radar and chartplotter,
  • 3 autopilot systems, one new in 2012 and two spares,
  • 8 sails, including cruising spinnaker, genoa, jib, storm sails and a large furling main.
  • 4 anchors, plus 300 feet of chain and 500 feet of rode,
  • 4 propellers, including two feathering props,
  • Lead Keel - 9,500 Lb
  • Life raft.

"Relentless" is ready to see in Anacortes, on dry dock.
AdditionalDetailDescription:
The full story...straight from the owners:

Relentless was designed and built by Robert McGuire of Santa Barbara, California.  The design follows the lines of Bruce Farr designed boats from the early 1980s, for example #89 and 100-1. 

Relentless was built with top quality materials and outfitted with oversized rigging and components.  The interior was simple without a lot of cruising gear that could fail and become dated.  We added items as they became important to us.  We sailed Relentless out of the Long Beach area of Southern California.  We spent many a weekend in Catalina with our son and friends aboard.  The boat was never challenged and never saw any weather of any kind.

In 2013 we sailed Relentless, non-stop, from Long Beach to Zihuatanejo, Mexico.  We left the day after Christmas 2012 during a small craft warning.  With only working sails we logged over 14 knots/hour for 6 to 8 hours.  We then sailed, over four months, back up the coast to Cabo San Lucas from where we sailed back to Long Beach.  We went out 600 miles southwest off shore and when the wind shifted tacked into Long Beach.

In May 2014 we shipped Relentless, on a ship, to Victoria, Canada and then headed to Alaska up through Southeast Alaska to Skagway, everywhere in between in Alaska and back to Anacortes, Washington.  This summer (2015) we sailed the British Columbia waters including the San Juans of Washington, the Gulf Islands, up Jervis Inlet, through Desolation Sound up to and through the Broughtons and back to the Seattle Area.

Relentless is ready for just about anything.  All systems have been upgraded and/or replaced for our recent cruises.  This includes a new engine, head, electronics, autopilot, sails, refrigeration, heating, batteries, charging system……… Our recent cruises have served as a tune-up; not remotely taxing the boat or systems.

Detail plans, layup detail, a full manual and survey results for both hull and rigging are available, if desired. Last insurance survey was completed in 2012.

Layout

ON DECK

  • The foredeck is flat, making it easy to walk around. Teak toe rails have been screwed in and glassed over. A large foredeck sliding hatch is great for ventilation and passing sails through. Also helping ventilation are two 5 inch holes on the very bow portion of the hull, near the anchor. These can be closed in rough seas.
  • Attached to the standing rigging are 4 fuel drums totaling 60 gallons.These where used as ferry tanks and are removable.
  • Underneath the boom at mid-ship is the first entrance hatch, which is protected by a soft dodger. This hatch leads to the salon.
  • Aft, there is a large and well-protected cockpit with a hard dodger that has a forward ventilation hatch. Steering is by tiller, and there is a tiller extension. The wide main traveler is behind the helm and can easily be controlled by the helmsman. There is a hydraulic backstay and vang.
  • On the aft starboard corner there is a stainless steel outboard davit with a 15HP outboard. 

INTERIOR

  • Forward, there is a large chain locker with 300 Feet of chain and 500 feet of line. Further aft, an inviting Forward Berth comfortably fits two. There is a large space next to the berth to port for sails, and to Starboard for other gear, including another outboard.
  • The Salon is warm and inviting. The ceiling and floors are all varnished and glowing (The floor is also well covered with carpet runners). there are long settee to each side and quarter berths above them, great for extra storage and sleeping. You can easily sleep four in the salon. The table with large leaves accomodates seating for at least 6, if not 8.
  • To Port is a nice Nav station with angled desk. Many surfaces have be redone with durable bamboo to nicely lighten the look. Plenty of storage there under the desk and with drawers. The Electrical panel is very well labelled. Some of the batteries are located under the seat. Just behind the Nav Station is the Head, which has a manual Lavac head and shower. 
  • To Starboard, next to the engine is the Galley which is split up and you can walkthrough to get aft. The sink is below the Companionway stairs (a nice plexiglass panel ensures cleanliness), and there is a customized cabinet for plates, dishes and cups. Across, there is a nice counter and two drop in Freezers/Fridges that are very power efficient and well sealed. There is a two burner stove with oven and Microwave. Plenty of nice drawers and cabinets for cookware.
  • Going Aft through the galley leads you to a corridor with an extra vanity with usable drawers, and through another door, to starboard is the very large Lazarette with loads of extras. There is also the ladder that goes to the aft cockpit, and to Port is the Aft Berth, large enough for two. There is a large access at the end of the berth for systems access.

Interior Features

GENERAL

  • Berths: Double berth in bow, two pilot berths two saloon berths and a double quarter berth.

  • Heater: both water and air are heated from engine coolant.

  • Tankage: Water 42 and 39 gal. tanks

                     Fuel: 42 gals. In boat, 60 gals on deck for deliveries. Transfer fuel pumps, one electric and one hand.

GALLEY

  • Propane Stove three burner, broiler and oven

  • Freezer and refrigeration: Separate units powered by 12 volt,

  • Double sink hot and cold foot pumps

  • Spare Refrigeration hot/cold plate

HEAD

  • Lavac Head with 25 Gal Holding tank,
  • Shower with Sump pump,
  • Porta-Pottie extra head,
  • Spare hand sanitary pump.

Deck & Hull Gear
  • Ground Tackle:  Delta 55, Bruce 44, Danforth T2500 and HT-20 along with a lunch hook,  300 feet of 5/16 G4 chain and 500 feet of line.
  • Windlass: Anchorlift 1500, with manual capability, two years of use.
  • Sea Drogue: 2 small parachutes, larger parachute.
  • Web reel for shore tying.
  • Spare rudder
  • Keel: 9,500 Lb Lead Fin Keel.
  • 4 Propellers: Feathering Prop, 3-blade feathering prop, Fixed Prop (12 Pitch), Fixed Prop (14 Pitch)
  • Hard Dodger protecting the cockpit, soft dodger protecting the mid-entrance hatch.

  • Safety Equipment: life raft, flares strobes and man-over-board paraphernalia, MOB Pole, Horse shoe, sling.

  • Fenders: (8), plus (1) Inflatable Step Fender

Sail Plan & Inventory
  • New Main & Jib, BOTH furling. The main has "behind the mast" furling system (See listing picture), Both main and headsail can be completely controlled from behind the hard dodger. 
  • 142% Genoa,
  • Spare main and jib (125%),
  • Staysail,
  • Storm staysail,
  • Cruising Spinnaker with sock, with spinnaker pole,
  • Sail Area: 943 SqFt; 433 SqFt of Main and 510 SqFt of headsail.

  • Winches: Lewmar, self-tailing; two 55s, four 46s and one 40

  • Winch Handles (5)

  • Hydraulic backstay and vang.

Electrical & Electronics
  • Charging System: two 170 Amp alternators with smart regulators and 40 Amp shore power charger.
  • DC System: 720 amp hours of golf cart batteries, plus starter battery,
  • Simrad NSS 7 3G Chartplotter w/Radar, GPS, Depth sensors (2013)
  • Separate Forward-looking Depth Sounder,

  • Three auto pilots, one new in 2012 and two spare units.

  • Spare VHF antenna for AIS,
  • VHF (2).

Engines
  • Engine: New Volkswagon 1.9 litre, 65 horse power, hours 650.
  • Cruising speed is 7 knots, top speed is 8.5 knots.
  • Propellers: one feathering, one folding and two fixed blade.
  • Fuel consumption at 7 knots is 1.12 gals/hour.

Extras
  • Inflatable: (1) Achilles 12' with electric pump, floor boards, seat cushion & oars and wheels, (1) Quicksilver 8' tender with wheels, seat and oars, foot pump.
  • Outboards: 15HP Honda, 4 HP Yamaha, 2 flush attachments.
  • Cleaning and Detail materials,
  • Dehumidifier (1),
  • Air driers (3),
  • Catalytic Heater (1),
  • Cockpit Table & Cushions with fillers to create a king sized bed in the cockpit for the tropics.
  • Wind Scoops (2) - One cloth and one Lexan, to be installed in forward cabin.
  • Bosun's Chair

GeneralBoatDescription:
This is the perfect cruising yacht for the Northwest! Fully loaded, Well-maintained, and she's ready to go.  She is rare Monk design and is truly a beautifully maintained yacht.  

  • Twin Perkins 200HP 
  • Upgraded with Stainless Steel Port lights
  • Zodiak Tender w/ outboard
  • Recent- Dometic Head upgrade.
  • House battery and Balmar alternators
  • Upgraded galley appliances
AdditionalDetailDescription:
Accomodations & Layout

"Cabernet" features a large two stateroom layout with down galley giving the salon a large open feeling with just the right amount of separation to the galley. The salon has a large settee to port and two chairs to starboard. The salon upholstery is in very good condition. The table is a drop-leaf type for easy stowage.

The master stateroom is aft with an island queen berth, hanging lockers, ample drawer storage and separate head and stall shower. The forward guest stateroom has a centerline double berth, hanging locker and drawer storage.  There is a day/guest head just aft to starboard directly across from the galley.

Salon & Galley

Salon:

The salon on "Cabernet" is bathed in natural light from her large windows.  There is plenty of seating for friends and family.  The rich teak interior is warm and inviting and features the following:

  • Large entrance doors both port and starboard
  • Lighting- Overhead and swing-arm reading lights.
  • (2) Barrel chairs to starboard
  • Sleeper sofa to port
  • Hand rails overhead
  • Storage lockers aft
  • Curtains on windows

Galley:

The Down Galley is well  laid out with great storage and has everything for meal & snack preparation.  There is plenty of light and it is open to the salon aft.  She features updated stove and refrigerator included in the list below:

  • Force 10- Four Burner propane stove/oven
  • Xintex- Propane Control
  • Panasonic Inverter Microwave oven
  • Sea Freeze- Refrigerator with freezer
  • Uline- Ice Maker
  • Large Stainless Steel sink
  • Ample storage
  • Custom- Wine rack

Master & Guest Staterooms

Master Stateroom:

The large private Master Stateroom is accessed aft from the salon through the port side companionway.  The stateroom features a center line queen berth, extensive lockers, drawers, and hanging lockers and a generous ensuite head with separate shower stall.

  • Queen walk-around bed
  • Large windows with Roman shades
  • Multiple drawers and hanging wardrobe
  • Hydronic heating system fan control
  • Overhead lights
  •  Reading lights
  • Intercom

Ensuite head:

  • Dometic fresh water toilet (Newer)
  • Storage above and below Vanity
  • Separate stall shower 
  • Overhead and Vanity lighting

Guest Cabin: 

The entrance to the guest accommodations is just forward of the Galley.  This VIP stateroom features a double sized walk around berth with great storage.   A large guest head is to starboard with separate shower stall.

  • Double walk-around bed
  • Large opening portlights & Lewmar hatch above.
  • Multiple drawers and hanging wardrobe
  • Hydronic heating system fan control
  • Overhead lights
  •  Reading lights
  • Stereo speakers
  • Intercom

Guest head:

  • Dometic fresh water toilet (Newer)
  • Storage above and below Vanity
  • Separate stall shower 
  • Overhead and Vanity lighting

Electronics & Navigation Equipment

Lower helm:

  • Dell Laptop with Coastal Explorer software
  • Cetrek- 727 Autopilot
  • Standard Horizon- Digital Depth Sounder
  • Standard Horizon- MAXI- VHF Radio
  • Richie- 5" Compass
  • VDO- Rudder Angle Indicator
  • Professional Mariner- Electrical 
  • ProSine- Inverter remote panel
  • Weems & Plath Clock & Barometer
  • Bennett- Trim Tab control
  • Clarion- Stereo system with speaker selection switches
  • Intercom

Upper Helm:

  • BigBay- Daylight screen for navigation system

  • Hummingbird Matrix 12 Sounder/Fishfinder

  • Icom- IC M80-  VHF Radio

  • Cetrek- 727 AutoPilot

  • VDO- Rudder Angle Indicator

  • 5" Ritchie Powerdamp Compass

  • Cybernet- CTX 1000- Hailer with fore and aft hailer horns

  • Benett- Trim Tab Control

Mechanical

 The engines are Perkins engines rated at 200hp. These engines are turbocharged. The size and horsepower is ample which makes for an ideal combination with the heavy semi-displacement CHB hull. These engines are well noted for their longevity, fuel economy and smooth running.  Fuel consumption noted 4.5 gallons per hour @ 1800RPM or approximately 10 knots.

  • Twin Perkins 200 HP engines w/2350vhours
  • Borg Warner- 2.0:1  transmissions
  • Dual Racor 75500MAX fuel filters with vacuum gauges
  • Automatic halon fire control system
  • Auto/manual bilge pumps
  • Bilge blowers

  • Dripless shaft seals

  • Fuel Tank guages port & starboard

  • TeleFlex Hydraulic steering

  • Onan- Generator with sound shield
  • Acoustical insulation

Electrical & Plumbing

The Electrical system is well designed on "Cabernet and boasts newer batteries, inverter and Balmar Alternators/regulators.  Additional items in this system are:

  • Onan- 7.5kW generator
  • 12 VDC & 120VAC  distribution panels at helm
  • 12 VDC- House & Engine battery banks
  • Pro Sine- 2.0-  2000 Watt Inverter/charger
  • (2) Balmar- 12VDC/180 Amp- Alternators
  • (2) Balmar- Max Charge MC-614- Multi Stage Regulator
  • Professional Mariner- Elecrical System Monitor
  • DC outlets at helms
  • Dockside electrical cables

Plumbing/Heating

  • Webasto- Hydronic diesel furnace
  • Torrid- 15 Gallon-  Stainless Steel Water Heater (New)
  • AMTROL- Expansion tank
  • Pressure water system

Flybridge & Deck

Flybridge:

The Flybridge on this yacht is wonderful for entertaining  with bench seating on either side as well as a bimini top to give protection from the sun.  Just aft and down three steps is a deck with safety rails with additional room for entertaining and has a table and seating for four.  The aft deck also has a large storage locker to starboard 

  • Helm Station with large venturi & full electronics
  • Helm chair
  • Storage under helm and aft deck
  • Port & starboard bench seating for 6 w/ storage underneath
  • Radar arch & Bimini Top
  • Lifesling
  • Table and chairs

Deck:

The Bow deck is perfectly set up for dealing with anchoring the vessel with a raised anchor platform.  Wide safe side decks on both sides lead to an aft deck area that serves mainly to launch and retrieve the Zodiak tender. 

  • Muir Windlass w/335' of 3/8 BBB and plow anchor
  • Anchor winch foot switch and remote control
  • Large Stainless Steel cleats and chocks
  •  Air Horn
  • Teak  decks and FRP swim platform
  • 10' Zodiak Tender w/new propane outboard
  • Weaver tender chocks with hand winch
  • Canvas: bimini, FB cover, dinghy motor cover, hand rails, and windows

GeneralBoatDescription:
"Galaman," this Hatteras 58 Yacht Fisherman is one of the finest examples of this very popular Motor Yacht available today.  The large 60Sq Ft. cockpit makes her a very versatile for fishing and docking with the added benefit of a wonderful-handling sea-kindly yacht.  She boasts an incredible list of upgrades including:

  • New ABI Tender with 40HP Yamaha
  • Continually updated systems and electronics
  • Sidepower- Thruster with proportional control(Three stations)
  • New exterior windows and frames
  • Fresh exterior Awlgrip paint job
  • New HRO watermaker
  • New Hydronic heating system- Olympia diesel boiler with Pex tubing throughout
  • Updated galley, updated salon with many custom features
  • Naiad stabilizers, Underwater lights,
  • Washer/dryer- new 2008,
  • Glendinning- electronic controls (w/third station in cockpit)

title: Hatteras 58- Yacht Fisher
desc: "Galaman" is a well maintained Hatteras Yacht Fisher- located in Seattle, WA

AdditionalDetailDescription:
Accommodations

This beautiful Yacht Fisherman has very spacious accommodations and numerous recent upgrades. The salon and lower helm station are wide open on the main deck offering uninterrupted, 360 degree, bow-to-stern visibility. This large comfortable space includes an L-shaped sofa, hi-lo teak table, an electric fireplace and entertainment center. Doors offer direct access to both port and starboard side decks. Large double doors to the rear of the salon lead to a covered and enclosed aft deck with plenty of seating, wet bar, and refrigerator for refreshments. Wing doors forward of the aft deck provide access to the covered side decks. An aft deck ladder leads up to the flybridge with an instrumented helm station, two helm chairs, a settee and tender storage.

Down from the aft deck- The large 60 Square foot cockpit is suitable for fishing or just relaxing. The transom door offers access from the cockpit to the large custom teak swim step.

Forward and down the stairway from the salon leads to the large modern galley and dining settee on the lower deck. Forward of the galley is a stacked washer and dryer (NEW 2008) then a forward guest stateroom with head. Going aft from the galley area is a companion way that leads past the split engine rooms to a second guest stateroom furnished with twin berths and plenty of storage. Across the companion way, to starboard, is a second guest head with shower. Fully aft is the full beam master stateroom with a custom walk-around queen berth (custom pillow-top mattress), hanging closet with custom mirrored doors, custom built-in seat, storage and ensuite head with shower.

Salon/Pilothouse

The salon has been redone with new soft goods including a custom built-in settee to port, leather helm chair, custom entertainment center with electric fireplace, LCD television on lift and surround sound system.  Other items include:

  • New windows and frames 
  • Custom L-shaped settee with large storage areas below cushions.
  • Marantz Stereo Receiver and DVD player
  • Cambridge speakers w/ subwoofer

Galley

The spacious galley has all high-end stainless steel appliances with gorgeous finishes featuring:

  • Miele- 4-burner  Ceramic electric range
  • Amana-  Stainless Steel refrigerator/freezer
  • Miele-  Dishwasher
  • Dacor- Convection microwave oven
  • Stainless steel sink
  • Garbage Disposal
  • Updated teak flooring (galley/dinette/forward stateroom)

Mechanical

Port Engine- Detroit Diesel 8V71TI- 450HP
Port Gear- Allison- M 20 R, Ratio 2:1

Starboard Engine- Detroit Diesel 8vT1TI- 450HP
Starboard Gear- Allison M 20 L, Ratio 2:1

  • New Fiberglass Exhaust system

  • Naiad hydraulic stabilizers

  • Custom digital engine gauges (main & FB helm)

  • Analog engine gauges (engine room)

  • Walker AirSeps

  • Engine block heaters

  • Racor 1000 remote fuel filters with vacuum gauges

  • Tank Tender (water/fuel)

  • Glendinning electronic engine controls & synchronizer

  • Bennett- Trim tabs

  • PYI- Dripless shaft seals

  • Oil change pump

  • CO2 fire suppression system

  • Shaft spurs

  • (2) Spare props

Electronics Pilothouse & Flybridge

The electronics aboard have been fully upgraded and installed in custom designed Pilothouse and Flybridge helms.  They include the following:

  • Furuno NavNet VX2 1944C
  • Furuno NavNet VX2 GP1920C
  • (2) Furuno 64-mile radar
  • (2) Furuno RD-30 with Smart Sensor
  • Furuno 1kW depth sounder
  • Simrad AP26 Autopilot with remote
  • Standard Horizon LH10 Hailer
  • Icom IC-M604 VHF radio w/new antenna
  • Icom IC-M404 VHF radio w/new antenna
  • Engine room cameras
  • Fuel Flow Scans
  • Seatel Coastal 18 Satellite TV
  • Cellular Phone Booster
  • Ritchie Compass
  • Custom stainless towers for twin 18" Seatel domes on radar arch

Electrical & Plumbing

Electrical

The electrical system was thoroughly gone through and new distribution panels were added in the Pilothouse.   The 8kW Generator was just rebuilt. 

  • Northern lights 8kW and 20kW Generators
  • Xantrex 2500 watt inverter with remote panel
  • (2) 32 Volt DC banks, (8) 6-volt
  • (2) 8D maintenance free
  • 50-amp shore power service
  • Lewco 12-volt charger
  • Sentry 32-volt charger
  • West Marine 40-amp battery charger
  • Custom 12-volt DC electronics panel
  • Upgraded 110-volt engine room lights

Plumbing system

The plumbing includes upgrades including a newly installed Hyrdonic heating system and Vacuflush sanitation system.

  • Olympia Boiler with Pex tubing for heat distribution
  • Everhot- Continuous hot water

Deck/Hull

The deck layout is very well thought out.  From her seating/sunpad and ample foredeck forward you have wide P/S walkways running aft with high safety rails and covered walkways.  Wing doors open onto the enclosed aft deck with L-shaped settee and teak table.  The aft cockpit has teak deck, teak swim step extended to 14", underwater lights, updated stair treads, and a custom teak caprail added.  Additiona deck features:

  • Cockpit Electronic Controls
  • Aluminum davit boom with winch
  • CQR 60lb. anchor
  • Fortress 55lb. anchor
  • 300' 3/8" chain
  • Heavy duty Galley Maid Windlass
  • Switlik 6-person emergency canister life raft
  • Flybridge bimini and helm canvas cover
  • Aft deck canvas enclosure
  • Custom radar arch
  • Sunpad and seat cushions on foredeck (new 2009)
  • (2) Fiberglass deck boxes
  • Updated cockpit and lazarette lighting

Master & Guest staterooms

Master Stateroom

The master stateroom is aft with large queen sized athwartship berth and custom settee tostarboard.  There is great storage including large drawers under the berth and hanging locker forward.  

  • Queen berth to port with custom pilow-top mattress
  • Custom settee
  • Reading lights
  • Large window aft with port lights to port and starboard

Ensuite head

  • Vacuflush head with porcelain bowl
  • Overhead and above mirror lighting
  • Storage behind mirror and under vanity
  • large stall shower with bi-fold door

VIP Stateroom

The VIP stateroom just forward of the master offers side by side single berths, plenty of storage, and a private guest head across the companionway

  • Single berths with storage drawers below
  • Large hanging locker
  • Overhead lighting and reading lights

Guest Head

  • Vacuflush head with porcelain bowl
  • Overhead and above mirror lighting
  • Storage behind mirror and under vanity
  • large stall shower with bi-fold door

Exclusions
  • Tender
  • Personal gear

Accommodations

 

  • General: The interior of Nautor Swan is truly stunning with beautifully hand rubbed teak cabinetry throughout and a varnished teak and holly sole. The boat has a very workable interior with an expansive, uncluttered feeling yet properly laid out for all sea conditions. She is an exceptionally well-maintained vessel that can easily be sailed by two people.
  • Owners Stateroom: The owners stateroom is aft with a center line queen and lough chairs on both sides. An aft hatch leads to the aft cockpit. There is a large locker to port with excellent access. Ample storage in lockers and drawers. The stateroom can be entered via companion through the galley to port or an en-suite head to starboard.
  • Main Salon: In the center of the boat is the main salon with an L shaped settee to port around a teak table.  A center settee facing the table encloses the generator in a soundproofed box. To starboard is the entertainment center with extensive hand rubbed teak cabinetry. Aft of the entertainment center is the nav. station.
  • Guest staterooms: There are two guest staterooms forward of the main salon. One is port, the other to starboard. Both have a large bunk at seat level and a drop down bunk above. Both have ample storage in lockers and drawers and have access to the forward head.
  • Forepeak: Forepeak is currently used for storage but can sleep two crew members. It can be entered by the forward hatch or through the forward head.

GeneralBoatDescription:
Introduced in 1970, the 40 Tri-Cabin was the first big yacht ever built by Tollycraft. A conservative design, she features a straightforward double-cabin interior with the galley in the salon and wraparound cabin windows.    

  • Extra-wide side decks and a complete lower helm station
  • Aft deck for dinghy (included)  
  • Solid fiberglass construction    


The aft stateroom is particularly spacious for a boat this size and came with twin single berths and direct access to the cockpit (a double berth was optional). Sliding deck doors are located port and starboard in the salon, and the interior woodwork is mahogany.

  • Re-powered in 2013 with fuel injected GM (Crusader brand) 7.4L big block 330hp gas engines with <500hrs total time.
  • Borg-Warner Velvet drives professionally rebuilt in 2013
  • Mechanical spaces are clean and dry

 

This is a great boat for exploring the Puget Sound, and also would make a good live aboard.

GeneralBoatDescription: The Hatteras 43 is a traditional fush-deck motor yacht whose quality construction, spacious accommodations and comfortable ride made her one of the most popular motor yachts ever produced. Like most Hatteras designs of her era, the 43 was built on a solid fiberglass, single-chine hull with a long keel and nearly flat after sections.  Low hour Johnson & Towers Detroit 6-71's power with Twin Disc transmissions, Onan 7.5KW diesel generator in a sound shield,  Heart 2KW inverter and Danforth anchor with five hundred feet of total rode.  Whether powering thru seas or on the hook, or as a live aboard, this vessel will give confidence and pride of ownership.
AdditionalDetailDescription:
Accommodations

Forward is a spacious v-berth and aft to port is the guest head with separate shower.  Moving aft is the large galley with abundant storage.  Aft and up find the home like salon with large windows and comfortable seating for entertaining.  Port aft and down the master stateroom has port and starboard berths, generous storage for a live aboard or extended cruising.  The master head to starboard also has a separate shower.  Port holes and a large overhead hatch provide light and ventilation.

GeneralBoatDescription:

AdditionalDetailDescription:
Manufacturer Provided Description
The dramatic, flowing silhouette of the 3060 Window Express is clearly of the Regal Yacht bloodline. Unmistakable are the rake of the bow and the graceful aft sweep of the arch. Large port and starboard cat-eye windows and sharply angled forward windows pour an abundance of natural light into the salon. The bright and airy interior is also spacious. The mid-cabin (usually reserved for children or storage) is large enough to be the master stateroom. More space, more light, and to complete the perfect 30, pulse-pounding performance.

Professionally installed Cummins Diamond series 250 Hp diesel engines, New fuel tanks, Topsides sprayed with Deltron urethane coating, Marine Deck 2000 decks and cockpit.
