GeneralBoatDescription:
Ready to cruise from Alaska to Mexico!

 

"Western Flyer", is an amazing example of a trawler yacht that was not only initially well outfitted with quality gear but maintained and upgraded by her current owner who is a very knowledgable yachtsman.  She has many incredible systems and redundancy throughout including:

  • Naiad Stabilizers (Upgraded to Datum system)
  • New Alexseal paint in 2013
  • New Navigation computer
  • Dual Autopilot systems
  • HRO Watermaker
  • Sidepower- Bow and Stern Thrusters
  • Grunnert and Sea Freeze- Freezers.
  • Cherry interior with gloss teak trim.
AdditionalDetailDescription:
General Layout

Two Stateroom layout with master forward and guest stateroom with bunks to port. Two heads, master has tub/shower and guest stateroom with shower.  Stepping from the cockpit to the main salon the settee is to port and the galley is centerline. The stairs up to the pilothouse are on the starboard side of the galley and their are stairs down to the staterooms on the port side of the galley. Teak & holly floors are throughout and interior panels are Cherry in a satin finish with Teak trim finished with a gloss varnish. Countertops throughout the salon and pilothouse are a gloss finished burl wood. The pilothouse is has a hi settee with watch berth behind. Interior access to the fly bridge on the port side of the pilothouse settee. The flybridge has two swiveling helm chairs and the boat deck aft stores the tender.

Salon & Galley

Salon

The salon looks and feels bright and airy with plenty of space to relax at the L-shaped settee.   The dinning table folds open to accommodate four for meals and closes for extra space.   There are storage cabinets/drawers  to port and starboard with additional storage space under the settee.  Additional features:

  • Gorgeous cherry interior with solid teak trim.
  • Desk with folding stool
  • Surround Sound Stereo system and TV
    •(5) Overhead speakers and sub-woofer
    •Sony- STR-DE485 Stereo system
    •AudioSource- AMP ONE/A- Power amplifier with four speakers
    •Toshiba SD-V392 VHS/DVD player
    •Direct TV Satellite receiver
    •APS- UPS for stereo system
    •LG 22LG30- 22" LCD TV
  • Sea Tel Satellite system & control Panel
  • Weather Station
  • (6) Sliding windows with screens
  • Dutch door to cockpit
  • Commissary with storage

Galley

The Galley on"Western Flyer" has the space and storage for gourmet meals or fixing a quick snack while under way.   A custom overhead cabinet to port matches the beautiful cherry interior perfectly providing additional storage and the perfect hanging wine glass rack.

  • Corian countertops with raised backsplash countertop
  • Double Stainless Steel sink with Grohe Faucet
  • Grunnert- Top loading, holding plate freezer.
  • Galley Maid- Three burner propane stove with oven
  • Sea Freeze- Refrigerator with freezer compartment on bottom and remote mounted compressor
  • Samsung- Microwave
  • Xintex- Remote propane switch and fume detector
  • HRO- Watermaker remote panel
  • Thru-counter trash bin
  • Custom built in LG- LCD TV above refrigerator

Pilothouse

The pilothouse is comfortable and has great visibility outside and access to her navigation systems is wonderful due to the expertise in their layout. Systems include:

  • Full suite of Navigation Electronics (Noted below)
  • Hynautic hydraulic steering with large traditional wheel
  • Sidepower- Bow and Stern Thruster controls
  • Morse- Engine and Transmission controls
  • Cummins- Engine panel
  • Westerbeke- Generator remote control and gauge panel.
  • Naiad- Datum- Stabilizer control
  • Muir- Anchor windlass-Auto anchor panel and breaker
  • Webasto- Heater control for system
  • Floscan- Series 9500- Fuel monitoring system w/ Digital tachometer and totalizer

  • RapidFix 406 EPIRB

  • Outback- Mate2M Controller for inverter
  • Selene- 120 VAC- 12VDC Distribution panel
  • Selene- Mimic panel with bilge pump control
  • CCTV system with Monitor and cameras in the engine room and cockpit

  • Jabsco 60010-2 Series 255SL Searchlight w/remote

  • Alpine CDA-9827 CD Receiver w/6 CD changer and 4 speakers

  • U-Line Ice maker

Navigation Electronics

The Navigation Electronics on "Western Flyer" are solid commercial grade units with redundancy in mind for safe passage making.  Nav Systems and Electronics were chosen and laid out for ease of use and dependable operation.   Care was taken so that Pilothouse and Fly Bridge station are complimentary and have a logical layout of screens and controls.

Pilothouse Electronics

  • Furuno- FR-7062 25kW High Performance Radar w/12" display and 6' open array antenna & ARP II Target plotter
  • Furuno 1731 Mark3 4kW back up radar system w/ 8" display & 2' Radome antenna
  • Furuno- GP-1850DF- Collor DGPS, Chartplotter, sounder,  w/ 7" color display(Includes charts from Mexico to Alaska)
  • Furuno- GP-30 GPS system
  • Furuno- FAX-207- Weatherfax
  • Big Bay- Tower PC w/Logitech wireless mouse and keyboard running Nobeltec navigation software
  • Samsung- SyncMaster 730B- 17” monitor
  • (2) Simrad- autopilots w/rate gyro compass w/ AP20 Control head, AP300 computer, RPU160 Hydraulic pump, JP21- Remote plug &  handheld remote control unit
  • Raymarine ST60 Anemometer 
  • Raymarine ST60 Depth Instrument
  • Raymarine ST60 Speed Instrument
  • CCTV camera system w/Engine room and Cockpit cameras
  • ICOM ICM127 VHF radio
  • Icom- IC-M710- Single Side Band Radio with AT-130 Tuner
  • APC Back-UPS LS700 uninterruptible power supply
  • Mitsubishi Satellite Phone
  • Panasonic DBS 824 Digital Business System (phone system) w/3 – Panasonic DBS 44 series key telephones
  • Phone Labs Dock-N-Talk Bluetooth phone station
  • WiFi Bridge
  • Wireless Router
  • AIS Receiver
  • Furuno Fax 207 weatherfax system and printer
  • KVH Trac Phone Inmarsat satellite phone system connected to Panasonic digital phone system

Flybridge electronics:

The Flybridge helm has two Todd helm seats and a nice compliment of electronics with a protective cover.  There is also a smart addition of a map holder for paper charts, also with a protective cover.  Electronics include:

  • Big Bay 12” Sunlight Viewable Monitor

  • Furuno- FMD-811- Radar remote display

  • Icom IC- M127 VHF Radio

  • Simrad- AP20- Control head for Autopilot

  • KVH TracPhone satellite phone antenna

  • Raymarine ST60 Multi-Instrument

Master and Guest Staterooms/Heads

Master Stateroom:

The master stateroom is located forward with a queen size berth and is easily the most quiet and relaxing areas on this yacht.  The ensuite head is to starboard and has plenty of light and a bath tub.  Under the berth is the bow thruster locker which is sealed off with a hatch providing a water tight compartment.

  • Queen sized island berth w/custom mattress
  • (2) Hanging lockers- cedar lined 
  • Hydronic heating outlets with thermostat
  • (4) Large stainless steel portlights with screens
  • Roman shades- Port and Starboard
  • Book shelves- Port and Starboard sides
  • Overhead lights
  • Accent Lights
  • "Lamp"  reading lights
  • Samsung LN-S2651D - 26" LCD TV
  • Raymarine ST60 repeater  in master stateroom
  • Mitsubishi DD-4030 DVD Player
  • Stereo speakers
  • Overhead hatch 

Ensuite Head

  • Corian countertop w/ built-in medicine cabinets above and storage below sink
  • Grohe faucet with under mount sink.
  • Large Bath tub with Grohe faucet
  • Lighting above mirror
  • Overhead lighting
  • Large Stainless steel portlights
  • Jabsco-  Fresh water toilet

Bow Thruster locker

  • Side Power SP155TC- 10hp BowThruster
  • Water tight lid                       
  • Bilge pump w/ automatic switch

Guest Stateroom

Just down three steps from the Salon to port is the companionway to the staterooms.   The Guest stateroom is very comfortable.  The custom folding door allows for a very open companionway or closes to provide nice private accommodations. Your guests will be comfortable in these large over under bunks.

  • Over under berths w/comfortable mattress'
  • Hanging locker- cedar lined
  • Hydronic heating with Hi/lo switch
  • Overhead lights
  • "Lamp"  reading lights
  • Large stainless steel portlights

Companionway:

Also across from the Guest stateroom is a Custom storage locker that can be used for pantry or spare parts storage.  The combination Washer/dryer is also in the companionway and is a vented unit.

Day/Guest Head

  • Corian countertop w/ built-in medicine cabinets above and storage below sink
  • Grohe faucet with under mount sink.
  • Stand up shower stall with adjustable shower fixture.
  • Lights above mirror
  • Overhead lighting
  • Large Stainless steel portlights
  • Jabsco-  Fresh water toilet

Flybridge & Deck

The Fly Bridge is spacious and well laid out with excellent running visibility from the Todd helm seats.  There is a custom Forespar mast providing a base for the ship's Radar and Satellite TV antennas. Aft of the mast is plenty of space for the Caribe tender that is launched with the boom/electric winches. Features:

  • Centerline helm with electronics
  • (2) Todd helm chairs
  • Hynautic steering w/stainless steel destroyer wheel
  • Forespar mast with heavy duty stainless steel stays, mast/boom, with (2) electric winches to lift tender
  • Caribe tender with 15HP Tohatsu- Outboard engine (New 2014)
  • Spreader lights
  • Sidepower- Bow and Stern thruster control
  • Muir- Anchor Windlass control
  • Jabsco- Spotlight remote control
  • Navigation Electronics (listed above)
  • SeaTel 1898S Satellite TV System custom mounted on mast
  • 24" Radome mounted on Mast

  • Stainless Steel- Arch & bimini with Sunbrella top and 6' Radar array mounted center.

  • Sea Freeze Freezer – 12V

  • Givens 4 person Offshore Liferaft w/canister

  • Ladder/Hatch access from aft deck

Main Deck 

The cockpit is accessed by the wide folding swim step. There are also side gates that eases boarding or stepping to the dock to secure mooring lines. The Cockpit and covered side decks are spacious and are safe and secure with non-skid decks, and high bulwarks. The teak caprail, clear of any fittings, is nicely varnished.  Forward of the pilothouse is the Portuguese bridge with plenty of storage.  The foredeck has plenty of space to launch and retrieve your anchor.  Further features:

  • Wide covered side & aft decks
  • Cockpit- Fresh Water hose bib
  • Cockpit- H&C Shower
  • Canvas covers on teak rails
  • Courtesy & Step lights
  • (3) Boarding gates
  • (6)Fender Chocks
  • Portuguese bridge with FRP door
  • Raised Anchor pulpit accommodates two anchors
  • Muir- Cheetah 12VDC windlass w/footswitch controls for up/down
  • 300' 3/8 BBB chain
  • CQR- Anchor 40kg.
  • Fortress- Lunch hook anchor with chain and rode
  • Hose bib- salt water Chain washdown
  • Stainless steel Samson post

Engineroom and Mechanical

The Engine room is well laid out with good access to her many systems.  Her Cummins engine is keel cooled and additional systems include:

  • Cummins Main Engine 6BTA5.9-  180HP diesel engine (2795 Hours)
  • Manual Oil and Temperature Guages
  • Twin Disc - MG 5050- Transmission
  • Keel Cooler for Main Engine
  • ESI- CFS-1000FR(E)- Fuel polishing system
  • Westerbeke 12kW  Generator (783 Hours)
  • Naiad Datum hydraulic stabilizer system
  • Floscan- Fuel management system
  • Selene- Custom fuel manifold
  • Webasto- DBW 2010- 2 Zone Hydronic heating system with Everhot
  • Reverso- GP3012- Oil Change system
  • PYI-Shaft seal 
  • Spurs line cutter on shaft
  • Prop speed applied to propeller 2013
  • Delco 120 Amp Alternator
  • Balmar- 210 Amp House bank alternator w/ regulator
  • Engine room camera

Electrical & Plumbing

Electrical:

The Selene Trawler electrical system is known to be a robust design, complex in layout but remarkably friendly to use.   The owner has carefully had these systems upgraded to meet his cruising needs.  These systems include: 

  • Outback VFX2812M - 2.8 kW Inverter with Mate2M Controller
  • Balmar- 210 Amp second alternator and Max charge regulator
  •  Newmar- PhaseThree PT 40- Battery charger
  • (6) US Battery - L16HC- 420 Amp Hour- House/inverter batteries
  • (1)  Group 27 Genset start Battery
  • (1) 8D 12VDC Engine start battery
  • Heavy duty battery disconnect switches for inverter, main engine, and parallel switch.
  • 125/50Amp shore power connections fore and aft
  • TV/Phone connection at bow & Stern
  • AC voltmeter/Ammeter
  • Galvanic isolator
  • Windlass control panel and system

Plumbing

  • Whale Pex Hot and Cold water tubing throughout
  • HRO  400 SEC Compact DC Watermaker
  • Raritan- 15 Gallon Hot Water heater
  • Groco- Paragon Senior- Pressure fresh water pump w/ rebuilt kits
  • Groco- F/W accumulator tank  
  • Flojet- Salt water pump
  • U-Line Icemaker
  • Fresh water tank- 220 Gallons   
  • Cold water hose bib in engine room
  • Rule- Bilge Pumps
    -Engine room-      2000 GPH
    -Commissary-      2000GPH
    -Lazarette-           2000GPH
    -Companionway-  2000GPH
    -Bow Locker-       2000GPH
  • Webasto 2010- Hydronic heating system 
    -Plumbed to 2 zones
    -Heat exchanger for engine  heat
    -All areas Individually controlled w/thermostats.
    -Heats domestic hot water with Everhot
  • Jabsco- Fresh water flush heads
  • Sealand- Macerator pump
  • Holding tank
  • Tank watcher 4- Holding tank indicator
  • Whale gusher- Manual bilge 
    pump- with manifold sourcing to:
    -Commissary

GeneralBoatDescription:
TWIN CUMMINS DIESEL POWER! 

 

Walking aboard this boat gives the impression of being in a larger yacht.   She has a large enclosed flybridge with plenty of seating, and a cockpit large enough for fishing or lounging in couple of deck chairs. She includes a wonderful RIB Tender with 25Hp Yamaha outboard mounter on a stern davits.

Features Include:

  • Twin Cummins 6BTA5.9 Diesel Engines
  • Reverse Cycle Heating and Airconditioning 
  • Westerbeke Generator
  • Comprehensive Electronics
  • Roskelly-Olsen transom davit with 12VDC winch
  • Beautifully enclosed Flybridge with high end rigid aluminum frame.
AdditionalDetailDescription:
General Description

This popular Carver Model offers one of the best layout options offered in a vessel this size.

A Euro-style transom features a swim platform with stow-away ladder and has a stern mounted davit for her tender. Easy access from ample cockpit to the cabin is provided via a large sliding door with screen. Large windows provide enhanced visibility and light in the bright, open cabin.  Up three steps, you find the galley to port with the Dinette/Helm opposite the galley on the starboard side.  Moving forward down three stairs to the port side single stateroom and to starboard is a full sized head, complete with glass enclosed shower. All the way forward is the queen master, with plenty of storage and a cedar lined hanging closet.

Salon & Galley

Salon:

  • Large sliding door opens Salon up to the aft deck
  • MarineAir- Reverse cycle air conditioning and heat 
  • Samsung  LCD HD Television
  • (2) Stereo speaker
  • Xintex- CO detector
  • Newly upholstered Sleeper Sofa
  • Newly upholstered barrel chairs
  • Newer curtains & Mini blinds

Galley & Dinette

The galley/dinette are up two steps from the salon and feature large windows for great visibility and light.  Forward of the dinette the seat back smartly converts into the Pilot seating for two.  The galley features plenty of storage and everything needed for extended cruising.         Features include:

  • Danby- Silhouette-  110VAC full sized refrigerator with freezer
  • Sharp Carousel- Grill II- Convection/Microwave oven
  • Galley Main- 2 Burner electric stove with oven
  • Stainless steel sink with Grohe faucet
  • MarineAir- Reverse cycle air conditioning and heat

GeneralBoatDescription: Fresh water kept under cover its entire life this fine example offers economical cruising, powered by an 200 Hp Volvo Diesel engine, Keypower bow thruster, Webasto forced air heat, redundant electronics at both helms, an AR 9.5 tender with a 9.5 Hp Suzuki outboard, Seawise davit system, full galley, Vacuflush head system and accommodations for four.
AdditionalDetailDescription:
Accommodations

Forward is the large V-Berth with the head just aft to Starboard. To Port you’ll find the spacious galley. Up and aft enter the salon with the helm to starboard and the settee to port.

Galley

  • Cockpit Hot/Cold Shower

Hull Design


The Keelform hull is the result of a science program of the University of British Columbia and Camano Marine. The goal of the program was the development of a hull which:
1 provides more speed with a given engine size;
2 reduces fuel consumption in the most widely used speed range -- between 12 and 18 knots;
3 can be stabilized to prevent the boat from rolling in rough seas without mechanical devices like stabilizers, etc. (Stabilizing should be possible at a low speed to avoid the hard pounding of normal semi-planing and planing hulls. In fact, the Keelform hull of the Camano 31 creates enough dynamic lift to stabilize the boat at a speed of only about 11 knots.)
4 runs 19-20 knots top speed and up to 18 knots cruising speed, with a single 200 hp Diesel engine; (At 8 knots the Camano 31 consumes just over 1.5 gallons of fuel and at 15 knots just over 6 gallons per hour, and it thus offers a fuel economy unmatched by any other hull form.)
5 provides a smooth, dry ride in rough water because of a special flare in the bow section of the Camano 31.

GeneralBoatDescription:
February 2016 Survey available for purchase. Owner has addressed most survey items, including changing a through-hull, entirely new bottom paint (stripped down to bare hull, all new coats), new batteries, and other items. (No major issues, no blisters, delamination)

Great price on a quality Hunter 35.5--one of the most popular Hunters made (Over 700 built).

"Osprey" Is a well cared-for Hunter 35.5 that shows well. She has two cabins and a single head with separate shower, a large galley with two burner stove and oven, BBQ astern. A great sailor, she is a reliable "cruiser/racer". Similar models have competed-and-won the Pacific Cup race and other races.

Features Include:

Layout

The Hunter 35.5 is an easily handled, fast cruiser with club racing speed. Above decks she offers a very comfortable cockpit with high coamings, walk-thru transom and large storage lockers. The wide side decks, inboard shrouds and sloping coach roof allow easy access forward and anchoring.

Other features include stainless steel hand rails, aluminum toe rail, inboard genoa tracks, swim platform and deep swim ladder.

Below decks the utilization of space and design create a very comfortable weekender and cruiser. She features two private cabins with full double berths, hanging lockers and standing headroom.

The main salon is very open and inviting offering room for relaxing, dinning and entertaining. She features an "L" shaped dinette with drop down leaf to port and long bench settee to starboard, with the navigation station at the back end of the bench. You can sit roughly 6-8 people at the dinner table.

The head is aft and features a full stall style shower, vanity and manual raw-water flushed marine head.

The cruising galley offers all the amenities needed for life aboard without intruding into the salon. Features include double stainless steel sinks, top loading ice box with 12v refrigeration, large counter tops and two-burner CNG stove with oven.

GeneralBoatDescription:
Major Re-fit Completed 2012

Just about a NEW boat

One of a Kind 

Fiberglassed below waterline - LP Paint above
AdditionalDetailDescription:
Hull & Deck

Carvel hull planks installed over Oak frames with S/S and Sillicon Bronze fasteners. All exterior hull seams were “wooded” using epoxy resin. The hull surface was completely stripped down to bare wood and surfaces faired and sealed with epoxy resin. The hull from the waterline down was encapsulated with fiberglass cloth and epoxy resin. Several barrier coats of epoxy primer were applied to the bottom followed by 2 full coats of anti-fouling bottom paint. Topsides and house were finished in high quality LP paint. Decking is tongue-and-groove planked with teak planking over the top. All new stainless steel deck hardware installed to include the S/S rub rail, Foredeck hatch, Anchor Roller, hawse pipe, chainplates, and stem fittings.

Cockpit

Tiller steering for keel hung rudder. Cockpit seating for 4 adults with 2 custom lightweight fiberglass storage compartments and 2 fiberglass ice chests. A sealed cockpit floor pan is installed covered with teak grating. The cockpit and ice chests drain into a sump for overboard pump out.

Spars & Rigging

Both masts being of a box design were opened to expose the internal area. The entire length of the masts were internally reinforced with unidirectional fiberglass for additional strength and laminated back together with epoxy resin. All spars were stripped to bare wood and coated with multiple coats of high quality spar varnish. The standing and running rigging have been completely replaced with new stainless wire and yacht braid. 4 new Lewmar winches were installed for sail handling.

History

 

Lewis Francis Herreshoff, the son of the famous Nathanael Herreshoff was a naval architect and author of numerous books. As a young man he worked with his father in the design of a variety of yachts and vessels. During WWI he designed ships for the U.S. Navy. In 1926 he became self employed designing racing and crusing yachts. Some of his most notable designs include the 1930 Americas Cup contender, the J class yacht Whirlwind; the almost unbeatable M class sloop Istalena; and the revolutionary R class sloops Yankee and Live Yankee. His designs ranged in length from 16 to over 130’.  His work is renowned for its artistic perfection and beauty. The Rozinante is design #98.

Systems

Electric marine toilet w/ FRP holding tank. Dual FRP water tanks with sink & pump. 12VDC & 110 VAC electrical panel with voltmeters, main and individual circuit breakers. Standard Horizon Eclipse VHF radio. 20 Amp battery charger, AC & DC outlets, and 20 amp shore power receptacle. 1 group 27 deep cycle battery for house loads and 2 installed for propulsion. Lightweight foam cored interior cabinetry

GeneralBoatDescription:
Owner has a new boat - This one needs a new home...NOW!!!

PRICE REDUCED

7 of 8 First place finishes in the 2015 San Diego Yachting Cup 

Sailing World Magazine's "Boat of the Year" 1999 cruiser/racer class.


Overall Winner of the Sydney to Hobart race.

"Twister" is a beautiful and well maintained version of this highly sought after racer/cruiser. With her powerful rig, deep keel, and efficient hull shape, the Sydney 41 is one of the few boats as comfortable on the race-course as she is crusing the Islands.

Designed by Ian Murray and built by Bashford International of Australia, the Sydney 41 illuminates the gulf between the American and overseas sailboat markets. Most American builders seem intent on separating their boats into very distinct racing and cruising classes, while overseas builders are quicker to translate success on the race course into cruising designs. The Sydney 41 was designed around the principle that performance is more important than rating, as speed is timeless and rating is subject to change. The basis of the 41's hull shape comes from the latest of grand prix thinking and is readily evident when under sail.

If you are looking for a great value in a performance sailboat, "Twister" should be one of the first boats you look at. She has had many substantial upgrades over the past few years. All of the systems, rig, hull, and sails are in excellent condition. She is a turn-key boat ready and eager to get a new owner out on the water.
AdditionalDetailDescription:
Dimensions
  • Ballast: 5480
  • Displacement: 13710

Tanks
  • Fuel: 24
  • Fresh Water: 52

Interior
The interior of the Sydney 41 is a departure from the traditional sport boat. Her layout is very accomodating for nights aboard whether you are doing a long distance race down the coast, or cruising the islands with the family.

The master cabin is located forward with a large double V-berth, hanging locker, and en-suite head. The main salon consists of a Large U-shaped dinette to port with a settee across to starboard. The interior cushoins were replaced in 2007 and the dinette table base was replaced with one custom built from teak in 2009. Aft of the dinette area is a very functional L-Shaped galley with a dual basin stainless steel sink, new LPG Force 10 oven with double burner stove, and large ice box. Dierctly across from the galley is the navigation station complete with electronics and plenty of storage. The rear section of the boat is configured with additional sleeping accomodations and plenty of storage. The starboard side a large cabin with double berth and an additional pipe berth for a third person. The port side is a large garage area with two removable pipe berths which is an ideal configuration, adaptable for whatever requirements you have for your voyage.
  • New cabin cushions 2007
  • New LPG stove/oven Force 10 (2 burner) 2009
  • Teak base for Settee table designed and built H&L Marine (2009)
  • (3) pipe berths, removable for cruising

Deck and Hull

The hull is a composite construction using Kevlar E-glass biaxial fabric, vinylester and epoxy resins and foam coring of varying thickness. The deck has a PVC core, with laminate and high-density foam supporting the flat areas beneath load-bearing deck fittings. The main structural bulkhead is solid fiberglass and the secondary bulkheads are composite. A fiberglass floor, coupled with the longitudinals, forms a structural grid in the bilge. The molded interior liners, with unidirectional fibers, stiffen the hull and help support the rig load. The high-lift, steel keel section has a lead bulb dangling more than 8 feet below the waterline. The externally fastened keel is attached to the hull with stainless steel bolts and is supported by a large, recessed backing plate. The balanced spade rudder is a composite construction around a tubular stainless steel stock.

The Cockpit is large, deep, and well set up for racing. All lines are led aft for easy accesss. The wheel is oversized for excellent control of the helm when seated in any position. The deck housing has a low profile allowing for a clear and open view of all points forward. All comings are curved and provide a great deal of comfort when seated and moving about. The side decks are wide and flat with limited obstructions making for excellent footing for crew when working on deck.

GeneralBoatDescription:
"Sajudis" is a classic Beneteau First 435 designed by the legendary German Frers. She has been cruised all over the world by her current owner, who has had her for twenty years, in places like Tahiti (1995), Thailand (2001), Turkey (2005), Trinidad (2007), and back to the Puget Sound for local boating since. 

Her interior layout is designed for comfortable cruising (also excellent for liveaboards), with plenty of seating in a nice appointed salon, a generous galley and added storage by the owner. Each of the cabins have their own heads. There are three diesel heating outlets--salon, and the cabins.

On the exterior, she boasts wide side decks, a cockpit with dodger and bimini that feels safe, with teak in the cockpit (none forward). A functional cockpit has lines led aft, access to two autopilot controls, 7 winches to run multiple head sails and the mainsheet, and an adjustable backstay. She comes with heavy-duty ground tackle (60Lb CQR, 230 Feet of chain and stern anchor). 

The First series by Beneteau is their racer-cruiser line, designed for off-shore use and speed while maintaining the comfort of a cruiser, as her vast interior reflects.

Some of her extensive inventory include:

  • 2 Cabins and 2 Heads Layout,
  • Espar Diesel Heat with three outlets,
  • 50 HP Perkins with Dripless Shaft Seal.
  • Radar Arch with Solar Panel and Furuno Radar,
  • Autohelm 7000 Autopilot and Windvane Steering,
  • 19 Inch Maxprop Feathering Prop,
  • Inverter/Charger, Isolation Transformer, Large Battery Bank,
  • Boat designed and upgraded by owner for offshore use.

"The First 435 is made for true sailors, for those who want to go far and in peace, without fearing extreme weather. Perfect lines and vast sail area make for a racing yacht performance, but she also has all the best qualities of a real cruiser: tough, powerful, easy to handle, she is extremely secure and life on board is wonderful." - Beneteau
AdditionalDetailDescription:
SAILS & SPARS
  • Spinnaker with sock. Lines and blocks.
  • Mainsail--old and ill fitting.
  • Lazy Jacks.
  • Head sail--none. Sheets good condition.
  • Trysail (Has its own track on mast).

GeneralBoatDescription:
Ready to Race

Founded in 1979, Alan Andrews Yacht Design specializes in creating high performance racing and cruising sailing yachts. Alan's basic design philosophy incorporates high performance sailing characteristics with solid, state-of-the-art engineering. The net result is a well-found yacht with a competitive lifetime outlasting current racing rules 
  
Alan combines this design expertise with his unique ability to listen, understand and achieve client requirements and goals. The client-architect relationship with this progressive firm extends far beyond line plans and interior drawings.

The end result of this collaboration are truly distinctive yachts that give the owner great pride when answering the query, "What kind of boat is that?"      

  "It's an Andrews! "

GeneralBoatDescription:
Here is your chance to own an attractive, low hour (<700), loaded up Sea Ray 340 Sundancer...she is our trade-in, thoroughly checked out, and ready for cruising!

In the last two seasons of operation, her props were professionally tuned, serpentine belts replaced, and gear lube serviced.   She has also received new bottom paint, impellers and seals, new batteries with battery boxes/lids, many of her halogen lights have been upgraded to low draw LEDs.   

 

 

Factory installed options include:

  • Smart Craft Vessel View
  • Kohler 5kw generator
  • AC/Heat
  • Salon and stateroom flat screen TVs with DVD players
  • Ray Marine SL 70 CRC 7" color LCD chart plotter with North America maps, GPS and closed dome radar
  • VHF radio
  • Custom Barrett Camper canvas enclosure

 

The vessel is priced to sell !
AdditionalDetailDescription:
General Description

In the 340 Sundancer, high performance, comfort and quality are beautifully combined in one sleek cruising package. Powered by twin MX6.2L MPI MerCruiser V-drives, the 340 Sundancer is the ticket that will let you discover a whole new world of boating. A roomy, cockpit offers plenty of opportunity to relax, and her sleeping accommodations for six mean family and friends can go right along with you.
